Title: Russia's war against Ukraine will end because the UN Charter will come into effect - the President
Description: The text of the President's speech was published on his official website. -One day, in this hall, they will definitely say that Russia's war against Ukraine is over: not frozen, not suspended, not forgotten - truly over. And it will not happen because someone is tired of the war. Not because someone bargained something out of Putin. Russia's war against Ukraine will end because the UN Charter will come into force. It should work. Our Ukrainian right to self-defense must prevail. Our cooperation with peoples of the world who value life as much as we do. Our territorial integrity. Our sovereignty, the independence of our country. We are protecting what every nation would certainly like to protect for itself. And what the UN Charter guarantees for everyone,- said Volodymyr Zelenskyi. According to him, it is Russia that always has to lie to justify its war. Not Ukraine. Russia cannot refer to the UN Charter to explain what it is doing against Ukraine. Actually, in her perverted way, in her distorted world, she does refer to the Statute, but this is simply madness. -Russia remained silent because it could not explain why a Russian missile recently hit a grain ship heading to an Egyptian port across the Black Sea. Russia is either silent or lying about why its drones and missiles are detected in the airspace of Poland, Moldova, and Romania. Ukrainians are injured and die every day. Daily. Today again Russian bombs hit residential buildings. Even an ordinary bakery became a target. What is so threatening for Russia in the production of bread? Putin has no answer. And Russia never has an honest answer to the question of why its army kills children in Ukraine, -defeats- schools and hospitals, fights not for justice, but for the blackout of a neighboring nation,- the President said. According to him, Putin has nothing to say if you ask him why he is trying to drag Belarus into war, why his propagandists threaten the peoples of the Caucasus or Central Asia, or why Russia invests most not in the development of humanity, but in hatred. Russia has no legitimate reason—absolutely—for making Iran and North Korea de facto accomplices in their criminal war in Europe when their weapons kill Ukrainians and help Putin steal Ukrainian land from the Ukrainian people. -We know that some people in the world want to talk to Putin. We know that. Meet, talk, communicate. But what exactly can they hear from him? That he is upset because we are exercising our right to protect our people? Or that he wants to continue the war and terror just so that no one thinks he was wrong? This is also madness,- noted Volodymyr Zelenskyi. He reminded that from the first second of this war, Russia is doing something that cannot be justified in any way according to the UN Charter. Every destroyed Ukrainian city, every burnt village — and there are already hundreds and hundreds of them — is proof that Russia is committing an international crime. And that is why this war cannot simply -subside-. -That is why this war cannot be calmed down by talks. Necessary actions. And I am grateful to all the nations that are really helping in ways that save the lives of our people. Putin has violated so many international norms and rules that he will not stop himself. Russia can only be forced to make peace. And this is exactly what is needed - to force Russia to make peace as the only aggressor in this war, the only violator of the UN Charter,- the President urged. He reminded that now, with the approach of the third winter of this war, Russia is again trying to destroy the Ukrainian energy industry, and this autumn it is acting even more cynically. -They are preparing to attack our nuclear power plants, three of them, we have this information and we have evidence of this. If Russia is willing to go this far, it means that none of what you value matters to Moscow. This kind of Russian cynicism will continue to strike if it is given any place in the world. The UN Charter leaves no room for this. And that is why the Peace Formula also leaves no room,- Volodymyr Zelenskyy assured. He recalled how in 2022, at the height of the war, while proposing the Peace Formula, he proposed to adhere to the UN Charter — to make effective everything for which this organization was created. Each point of the Peace Formula is based on the principles, goals and norms of the UN Charter - on the rights it guarantees to countries and on the resolutions of the General Assembly, which are already supported by the majority of countries. -And there are not different versions of the UN Charter for different parts of the world. There are no regional quasi-statutes. There is no separate UN Charter for the BRICS or the G7. There is no separate Russian-Iranian UN Charter or separate Sino-Brazilian UN Charter. There is only one UN Charter that unites everyone — should unite everyone. There is only one way to a just peace - clear steps that everyone understands equally, and this is reflected in the Peace Formula. This is the implementation of the UN Charter. And we all know what needs to be done if we honestly assess the situation and really want to stop Russia's war. And the most important thing is to act. Together, of course. Of course, in unity. Without creating new and unnecessary divisions of the world into blocs or regional groups. Unity always works for the benefit of peace,- the President assured. He stated that it is necessary to prepare a second Peace Summit to end the war. All together. And invited all principled nations to join Ukraine in this process. All those who truly respect the UN Charter. -We invite China. We invite Brazil. I have already invited India. We work with African countries, with all of Latin America, the Middle East, Central Asia, Europe, the Pacific region, and North America. All are equally important for peace. All of them. No exceptions. Just as the UN Charter should work without exception. This is the process that will lead us to peace. To a just peace. Real peace. Peace that will last. We all already know how to achieve it. We have the Peace Formula. We have the UN Charter. And we have all the forces necessary to implement this. All it takes is determination. Thank you very much. Glory to Ukraine!- Volodymyr Zelenskyi said. As reported by ArmyInform, The President discussed with the US Congress defense packages and strengthening of sanctions against the Russian Federation.

Title: Financial assistance to veterans: how to apply online
Description: The portal works according to the -single window- principle. More than 40 different services are currently available. Among them are social, medical, educational and others. Among the categories of services, one of the most relevant is service material help. There, defenders, their family members and the families of the victims can remotely apply for annual financial assistance. ArmyInform tells how veterans can use the service online and what needs to be done. So, let's go. by link, we submit an application and undergo authorization. For this you need to confirm your identity. You can do this in several ways: using a personal key or the ID.GOV.UA system, through Action.Signature. The registration procedure takes only 3 minutes. They specify your personal and passport data, your status (combatant, person with disabilities or family member of the deceased), email address, phone number, registration address, information about a bank card for charges, documents confirming the right to benefits. Next, sign the application again in a convenient way for you, for example, with a personal key or through Action.Signature. Your documents are considered for 30 days. After they have been processed, the applicant will be informed through his personal account and by e-mail about the results of financial assistance. The funds will be deposited into the applicant's bank account. Material assistance is provided by decision of the Kyiv City Council once a year. Last year, the financial assistance amounted to: – to Kyivans participating in the ATO — 5 thousand hryvnias each; – to Kyivans participating in the anti-terrorist operation, defenders and defenders with disabilities of group I — 30 thousand hryvnias each; – Kyiv citizens participating in the anti-terrorist operation, defenders with disabilities of group II — 20 thousand hryvnias each; – 30,000 each to the family members of the fallen Kyiv citizens who participated in the anti-terrorist operation or perform combat tasks while repelling large-scale Russian aggression against Ukraine. More detailed information about service provision can be read on the -Portal of Defenders and Defenders-.

Title: Surface radio electronic fighter: French developers offer military sailors the Magellan drone
Description: How informed the defense portal EDR, the mission of the novelty is to perform various tasks, starting from radio-electronic warfare, information gathering, target detection and identification, and ending with reconnaissance and surveillance of surface and underwater objects, ArmyInform reports. With a length of six meters and a displacement of 1,000 to 1,200 kilograms, Magellan is an addition to the Couach product line. from its R&D department, Couach Shipyard, to ensure a systematic response to the needs expressed by customers. According to the designers of the unmanned vessel, it was expected to embody three key characteristics: technological modularity, perfect sea characteristics and practicality of operation. The ship's hull is made of composite, carbon and Kevlar, which makes it strong and adaptable to defense needs. Couach Shipyard's research in maritime security makes Magellan a platform capable of handling the constraints at sea. The drone is highly resistant to water and was designed using self-leveling technology. Its innovative hybrid diesel-electric propulsion is based on the use of a 13 kW micro-turbine, which allows it to sail for 5 days at a speed of 6 knots with reduced noise to provide drone camouflage. Magellan features a modular technology platform design capable of carrying a large volumetric payload – over 500 liters – for the integration of end-user-selected equipment. The drone can be equipped with modules that allow, for example, to deploy acoustic buoys or ESM (electronic support measures) modules. The marine drone in the USV version contains a mission planning module, its ground or airborne control center provides mission monitoring for its user. The design of the drone has been optimized by Chantier Naval Couach's research and development department to maximize its practicality for the user. The Magellan Marine Drone is designed to be easily transported in a standard 20-foot container and retrieved without assistance thanks to its retractable mast and lifting hook without the use of a recovery system. Couach Shipyard, already recognized for its expertise in the construction of composite ships, applied its expertise to the field of drones for the first time with the Magellan. This development is the result of a high-tech turnaround by Couach following the establishment of a research and development department at the shipyard, which has already led to a significant increase in system integration skills on ships.

Title: Defense of Zmiyny, capture and reward for battles in Kurshchyna: the story of Major Kryklyvy
Description: One of the names on the list of awardees is Major Yaroslav Kryklyvy. The officer was awarded the Order of Bohdan Khmelnytskyi, II degree. He is currently the commanding officer of the 501st Marine Corps Separate Battalion. ArmyInform tells more about the serviceman. In 2020, Yaroslav Kryklyvy had the rank of lieutenant. During one of the exercises in the Black Sea, the officer was the commander of a marine infantry platoon in the ranks of the 88th separate MP battalion. In 2021, the officer already headed the company and, together with the unit, participated in the international Agile Spirit training. 2022. A full scale invasion. Yaroslav Kryklyvy performed tasks on Zmiiny Island. The battalion was on the island in rotation: a month there, a month at home for retraining. With irony, he says that he met a great war -on a tropical island.- The combatant recalls that on the morning of February 24, 2022, a military observation post reported a warship on the horizon. It was the Moscow missile cruiser. Several more enemy ships followed him. At first, Zmiiny fired at the cruiser -Moscow-, after that the enemy used other ships and aircraft. Yaroslav Kryklyvy became one of those captured by the Russian military at Zmiyny. First, they were taken to the temporarily occupied Crimea, then they promised to take them to mainland Ukraine, but they brought them to the territory where there was frost and a lot of snow. Yaroslav does not know the exact location, he only remembers that it took about 12 hours to fly from Sevastopol. The prisoners were kept in the camp, they were constantly interrogated by the Federal Security Service of the Russian Federation, the attitude of the guards was inhumane, recalls the battalion commander: - The guards allowed themselves to do just what they wanted. There was a rat race. If you want to go, roughly speaking, for a cigarette, you will be released from the cell. They give you time, you start to run away, then they release the dog. Didn't have time - -he will bite you, no problem,- recalls In 2023, Officer Screaming commanded the 501st Marine Separate Battalion. In particular, the military is involved in the operation of the Defense Forces of Ukraine on the territory of the Kursk region. They work effectively. Yes, on September 23, the Navy Command shared video , how servicemen of the 501st battalion capture the enemy in Kurshchyna. Marines of the 501st Separate Marine Corps Battalion continue to help the young Kursk Republic rid itself of Putin's regime and replenish the exchange fund. Glory to Ukraine!Glory to the marines! pic.twitter.com/5WgIyKVis6 — Naval Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine (@UA_NAVY) September 23, 2024 And his second -Bohdan-, this high state award, the officer received for combat operations in the Kursk region. We believe that this is not the last award for quality service to the Ukrainian people.

Title: Why is the enemy lying about the F-16
Description: Fake information is spreading on the Internet that the Pentagon allegedly believes that Ukrainian pilots are -unfit to perform complex tasks on F-16 fighter jets.- It is because of this that Ukraine has allegedly already lost one plane and does not cross the front line with fighter jets. The authors of the -dump- refer to interview of the commander of the US Air Force in Europe and Africa, General James Hecker, to the Air & Space Forces Magazine. In fact, American General James Hacker did not make such categorical statements. Propagandists deliberately distorted the content of the general's interview in order to once again -cast a shadow- on the Ukrainian military and to quarrel Ukraine with its allies. James Hecker did not say anything about the -unsuitability- of Ukrainian pilots. On the contrary, the publication emphasizes that F-16s are successfully used to destroy Russian cruise missiles and drones. Moreover, according to the commander, Ukrainian F-16 maintenance specialists demonstrate high results. Of course, there is no statement in the original publication that Ukrainian pilots do not fly into the temporarily occupied territories or Russian airspace because of their -unqualification-. The content of the alleged Russian quotes from this interview is a complete lie. Fakers hoped that Ukrainian journalists would pick up this -deza- without checking the original text. But this time it was possible to expose the forgery. However, it often happens that our journalists, in pursuit of sensationalism, rebroadcast enemy propaganda narratives and spread fabrications ordered by the Kremlin. That is why, if the information causes even a little doubt, its sources should be carefully checked.

Title: -The best we have-. The crew talks about the unique mortar -Rak- based on the APC -Rosomak-
Description: This is the newest technique that has proven itself very well on the battlefield. And yes, in terms of accuracy and maneuverability, there is no time to look for something similar among mortars. The commanders of the crews of these mortars told the correspondent of Armiya TV about the advantages and technical characteristics, as well as combat missions and tasks of -Rak-. We meet with the guys in camouflaged positions during combat duty. Mortars are driven into caponiers, covered with a net and blend into the thick of the forest, but are ready to go out on a combat mission at any moment. -Rak- works on the basis of the -Rosomak- armored personnel carrier and is able to cover with accurate fire the concentration of enemy infantry. Usually our guys work on it at a distance of 5-6 km from -zero-. After receiving a combat mission, they go to the specified position, deploy in a matter of seconds and, after working, return to a relatively safe place of deployment. . Or the way the guys work now: get the target early, get closer, practice and hide back. If you stand on the defensive, close to the skirmish line, without moving, then there is a threat of detection. Therefore, the machines are deployed a little further away, taking turns to perform tasks. -Rosomak- allows you to move quickly, and -Rak- itself does not need special deployment. The guys say that the most time is spent on pointing – the machine needs some time to -find- itself in space. It happened that the system itself took longer to prepare than the combat work lasted. -In general, I like everything, cool equipment. The main thing – mobile To be honest, I thought it would last less. But he spends so much time fighting,- – Mitya admits. The Russians have a special interest in this technique, as in all foreign ones, they hunt for it. The crew commander explains that it is not a static mortar that stands in a specific place: it is not set at zero, and in general it is used very competently. -This is a fat target, the car is so double-decker,- – says Mitya, casting a proud glance at Rosomak, hidden next to us in the hood. All the fighters of the crew, and there are four of them working on the -Rak-, constantly emphasize that mortars are very important in the current combat realities. -In order to leave, he did the work and hid. So that foreign copters could not burn our positions. When it is stationary, the threat of detection is much higher. And just like here, he came, worked and returned,- – says fighter Oleg, who in the crew is responsible for supplying mines. In general, the execution of a standard combat task can take 5-10 minutes. Most of the time is spent on the machine -finding- itself on the battlefield before working on an enemy target. -Rak- – this is a 120 mm mortar that began to be developed by Poland in the mid-zeros. More than ten years passed until this weapon, based on the -Rosomak- armored personnel carrier, entered service with the Polish Army. This is its uniqueness – the Polish defense company actually developed from scratch and launched practical and modern weapons that are competitive on the world market. It became known in the spring of 2023 that Warsaw would transfer these mortars to Kyiv. The crew commander with the call sign -Bob- recalls: we trained on simple mortars in Poland, and then just during the training it became known that they were giving us -Rak-, so we immediately and switched to them. If we talk about the maintenance of this equipment, our soldiers say, there are no particular issues here either. After the fire, with the help of a compressor, powder gases are immediately blown out and liquid is supplied, which cools the barrel. The guys work on average 5 km from the front line. At such a distance, -Rak- hits very accurately. The TTX indicates that its maximum range is 12 km. But -Bob- says that during the exercises, when it came to such long-range projectiles, even the Poles themselves had not seen them. In general, adds - Mityai-, he can aim -in an apple- at 6500 m. -At this distance hits perfectly. And he can go on and on, pouring and pouring. Maybe the copters will help to hover there a little left and right. And you can take it apart,- – he explains. If we talk about weather conditions, the car performs well in various situations. Doesn't he really like the swamp? The commander adds that the car is heavy, 24 tons, and can get stuck in a rut in the field in the rain and not get out. Worked fine in the winter. -But on a flat road it goes 100 km/h, we drove like that in the field. It can drive 110 km/h on asphalt,- – - Mityai- tells not without delight. One of these trips is immediately remembered by -Bob-, the commander of the same -Rak-: we were told that they were already flying after us - Lancet- and -Supercam- had to return urgently. -He gave (gas, &#8211 ; ed.), I was already afraid of the -Supercam-, but the speed at which we were driving. But he is handsome. Inside there, you had to hold on with all your might,- – says the fighter. Now the guys are working in manual mine feeding mode, although basically in -Rak- it happens automatically. It does not affect the working time, so it is even faster to work out, say the fighters and laugh: maybe the charger sweats more, there is not much space, so it is quite uncomfortable for him. The undoubted technological advantage of the mortar is the -Topaz- digital fire control system. -The machine itself knows where it is. I can move 500 meters to the side, it will adjust the data and continue to work,- – details -Mitaya-. At the same time, the crew commander points out that it is not worth putting her stationary so that she guards -zero-, because in the era of drones, she will probably be found quickly. Our -Rak- can carry 20 mines in a cassette and another 26 on board. The fighters explain how they work: one machine is loaded while the other works at the position. When the ammunition ran out, it was immediately replaced by the next one, and so on in a circle. The car is good, it cannot be compared with Soviet equipment, the crew members sincerely say: -It has cruise control here , music can be heard in the cabin, even inside the tower. When we've worked it out, and we go back, we drive under a hundred, we turn it on via AUX for ourselves.- When asked if the Russians are afraid of such weapons, the crew says: previously, during combat work, the occupiers simply did not understand what was the matter – when a couple of mines landed very precisely in each landing. They heard their negotiations, they simply did not understand that this is how mines fall one after another. Mainly, says the commander, they work on foot: - they, the Russians, are constantly trying to advance, then ours detect accumulations of manpower, warehouses in landings, where they are entrenched- . TheRak is a very accurate weapon, both crew commanders agree, and compared to other mortars, it is the best the Defense Force has. -He can attack well, also has a flurry mode – when three mines in a row are released under different trajectories. We also shot like that, only two, because for the third we need a clear horizon – it should take off at such an angle that it is too close to the collision line,- – says -Mitya-. -Bob- says that once a day six left in three crews. Then the Russians wanted to develop active offensive actions, so the mortars had to work on the accumulation of manpower in the landings. About a hundred mines were released in a day. The guys appreciate the training in Poland with gratitude, but they don't use much of what they learned in real combat. They admit that they have to gain experience on the go. They were taught well in Poland, there are no complaints about that, but they don't see the war that way, explains -Bob- and clarifies: they think they can come, deploy, as the book says . For example, during the exercises, the instructors there said that wait for the target until you get the coordinates for the car. But now in our war we don't have time to stand in the middle of the field like that wait, it's unrealistic, adds the commander. In general, -Mitjai- admits, he can now go to Poland himself and tell a couple of secrets about -Rak- . The boys are grateful to the Poles and French, who -put their soul- into the training of our soldiers: -When they saw us off, they cried.- During the conversation, the language I also talked about the fact that some people are afraid to join the Defense Forces, justifying it for various reasons. -Mityai- understands this attitude in some way, and states: yes, there are problems, but this does not mean that one should sit back. -Yes, there is a question. But what to do? Maybe you are right, somewhere there is a lack of a smart commander or something else. But what to do? Well, come, be smart, do something, help. I always question such people, ok, you are right, but what next, what are your actions? Just sit and wait? There is no answer,- – he explains. The crew commander, a large man with a strong physique, admits that he himself did not plan to be in this place – I always didn't like -boxes-, although I served since the time of the ATO. -I tell them, I don't want to wear armor. Let's study with a mortar. So he got into the mortar box. But I don't regret being here at all,- – he recalls his transfer. A mechanic-driver -Rak- with the call sign -Forest- adds that, in his opinion, in the army any experience will be useful: from an IT specialist to a cook, to a technician and a tractor driver. -In short, I don't know except what a janitor in the army can do... Ah, sweep tracks!-, – he jokes. Our conversation is interrupted by three distinct explosions nearby. The guys say that a few kilometers away, the Russians are -unwinding- the settlement with KABs. According to them, the occupier's usual tactics in this area – simply erase villages and cities. -Oh, they finish with cassettes. Probably -Hurricane--, – says one of the fighters. While the occupiers are burning our land with -squares-, the crews of -Rak- self-propelled mortars are returning to combat duty. After all, at any moment they can be called to a task: leave, destroy the enemy with accurate fire, and hide in their capon again. More about the self-propelled mortar -Rak- based on the -Rosomak- armored personnel carrier, watch soon on the Army TV channel, subscribe here so you don't miss it.

Title: The enemy used 82 anti-aircraft missiles and 730 kamikaze drones — General Staff of the Armed Forces
Description: Operational information as of 22.00 on September 24 was published by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The Russian invaders launched one missile strike, 57 airstrikes, dropping 82 guided aerial bombs on the territory of Ukraine. In addition, more than 730 kamikaze drones were engaged for destruction and more than 3,600 attacks were carried out on the positions of our troops and populated areas. In the Kharkiv direction, the enemy stormed the positions of our units in the Vovchansk district three times in vain. At the same time, enemy aviation from the Shebekino (Russian Federation) side inflicted devastating blows with guided aerial bombs on the residential areas and civilian infrastructure of Kharkov (seven KAB) and Vovchansk. In the Kupyansk direction, the aggressor carried out offensive actions near Synkivka, Stelmakhivka, Andriivka, Pischany, Kruglyakivka, and Lozova. Ukrainian defenders stopped 11 enemy attacks. The battle is still going on near Kruglyakivka. In the Lymansky direction, Russian invaders attacked the positions of the Defense Forces 22 times near Druzhelyubivka, Cherneshchyna, Grekivka, Nevsky, Torsky, Makiivka, Zarichny, and Novosadovo. Seven clashes are still ongoing. In the Siverskyi direction, our defenders repelled three assaults by the occupying forces in the direction of Verkhnokamyanskyi and Bilogorivka. In the Kramatorsk direction, the enemy, with the support of aviation, attacked our positions near Mankivka, Kalynyvka, Stupochky and White Mountain. The defense forces stopped seven attacks by the invaders, two more clashes are ongoing. There were 10 battles in the Toretsk direction. The Russians also, with the support of aviation, stormed the positions of Ukrainian units in the direction of Toretsk and Shcherbinivka. All attacks of the aggressor were repelled. In the Pokrovsky direction, since the beginning of this day, the enemy attacked 24 times in the areas of Vozdvizhenka, Novotoretsk, Zeleny Pol, Novogrodivka, Krasny Yar, Mykolaivka, and Marynivka. Our defenders repelled 23 enemy assaults. The battle is still going on near Krasny Yar. Today, according to preliminary data, 328 occupiers were neutralized in this direction, 134 of them irreversibly. Five tanks, six BBM and eight cars were also destroyed. Another tank, three BBMs, 11 artillery systems and three cars were damaged. In the Kurakhiv direction, the enemy made 19 attempts to break through our defenses near Tsukuriny, Zhelany Drugo, Georgiivka, Dalny, Kostyantynivka, and Katerynivka. Fifteen battles have ended, four more are still ongoing. In this direction, according to preliminary data, the loss of the enemy as irretrievable and wounded amounted to 52 people. An armored combat vehicle and a car were also destroyed. In the Vremivsk direction, the enemy attacked our units eight times near Vugledar, Pavlivka, Katerynivka, and Vodyanyi. At this time, our soldiers repelled half of the attacks, four more clashes are ongoing. In the Dnieper direction, the invading troops tried in vain to dislodge units of the Defense Forces from their occupied positions three times in vain. They suffered losses and retreated. There are no significant changes in the rest of the directions. The operation is ongoing in the Kursk region. Enemy aviation continues to destroy its villages and cities with guided aerial bombs. Today, it is worth noting the soldiers of the 118th separate mechanized brigade, the 57th separate motorized infantry brigade named after Kostya Hordienko, the chieftain of Kostya, and the 110th separate mechanized brigade named after Colonel-General Mark Bezruchka, who are effectively destroying the enemy, inflicting significant losses in manpower and equipment. As reported by ArmyInform, the Lyman direction came to the top in the number of enemy attacks.

Title: A delegation of the Armed Forces of Lithuania visited Ukraine
Description: The Land Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine reported this on September 24. The delegation led by the commander of the Ground Forces of the Armed Forces of the Republic of Lithuania, Brigadier General Arturas Radvilas, visited higher military educational institutions and training centers, met with the commander of the Ground Forces of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, Lieutenant General Oleksandr Pavliuk. The representatives of the Ukrainian side talked about the training of personnel, demonstrated the material and technical base, and shared the experience of conducting combat operations in modern conditions. The delegation of the Armed Forces of the Republic of Lithuania highly appreciated the Ukrainian experience in the use of electronic warfare (EW) and unmanned aerial systems (UAVs), which are an important part of the Armed Forces. In particular, each brigade of the Ground Forces has its own separate units that perform such functions. The guests noted the high level of quality of the training programs that were developed and used in Ukraine for the training of cadets of educational institutions and servicemen of the Armed Forces units. The commander of the Ground Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, Lieutenant General Oleksandr Pavlyuk, noted the readiness to share with international partners the experience of using electronic warfare and air defense systems, acquired during the conduct of hostilities against the Russian aggressor. In particular, the Department of Accumulation and Generalization of Experience has been created within the Ground Forces Command, the activities of which will soon be presented to the military attachés of the embassies of partner countries. The Lithuanian guests also saw the passing of a psychological obstacle course by military personnel undergoing basic military training. This test is important and one of the most difficult stages of every fighter's training. In conditions as close as possible to combat, Ukrainian servicemen, accompanied by experienced instructors, demonstrate tactical training skills, physical endurance and psychological stability. At the end of the visit, Brigadier General Arturas Radvilas visited the Chernobyl zone. It was here in 2022 that one of the routes to the occupation of part of the Kyiv region by the Russian army lay. The consequences of those events were the terrible crimes of the Russians, in particular, the mass murders of the civilian population in the communities of the Kyiv region, which were condemned by the civilized world. Cooperation with Lithuanian partners allows the Ground Forces to become stronger. In turn, NATO member states gain a better understanding of the threat of neighboring an aggressor state and the importance of Ukrainian experience in effectively countering such risks. As reported by ArmyInform, the head of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Lithuania visited the fortifications in Chernihiv region.

The Ministry of Defense also has an internal anti-corruption service and a separate internal audit department. -We do not reveal the algorithm of work - if someone thinks that they are smarter than our people, they will end up like that,- added Rustem Umyerov. As reported by ArmyInform, Rustem Umyerov held a meeting with the ambassadors of the Group of Seven (G7) countries and summarized the team's achievements during the first year of work in the department.

Title: He simply could not stay away from that trouble - the TCC officer told about his motivation
Description: combat path of the officer was told by operational command -North-. Yuriy is a teacher by education. He worked by profession, then in local self-government bodies. He was the deputy and then the chairman of the district council. On February 24, 2022, he volunteered for the TCC and SP in Kozel region. At that time, his military experience consisted only of short-term service in the late 1980s. In the early 2000s, he completed training and obtained the rank of lieutenant, military specialty — an officer from the Military Academy. -Like most volunteers, I was motivated by the realization that I had to go to defend my Motherland, my own family. I simply could not stay away from the disaster that fell on our land,- Yuriy Marchenko said. He was immediately mobilized to the security company of the TCC and SP in Kozel region. He was the deputy commander for moral and psychological support. But a year later, on February 24, 2023, he voluntarily enrolled in the ranks of the 407th separate rifle battalion, which was just being formed at that time. Appointed to the position of commander of a rifle company, and a few months later transferred to the position of head of the intelligence group of the headquarters. After three months of training and coordination, in May 2023, the unit went to the place of execution of tasks. Kharkiv Oblast, then Kherson Oblast, Kyiv Oblast. Performed the task of protecting objects on 2-3 lines of defense. In the fall, they received a new task: to advance into Donetsk region in the Avdiyiv direction. -At the end of October, they got to the Avdiiv coke plant. I was the chief of military intelligence, we were engaged in planning. The main thing was establishing cooperation with other units, planning reconnaissance and surveillance of the enemy, and providing information to the command,- Yuriy Marchenko recalled. The enemy constantly attacked the positions of the rifle battalion with various types of weapons - mortars, artillery, tanks, regularly dropped from the planes of the KaBa. Heavy fighting took place when the enemy entered the rear of the Ukrainian units through the extensive system of underground communications in the -Tsarska Okhota- area at the end of January. Then the attack was repulsed, all communications on the territory of the plant were worked out in order to prevent the enemy from entering the territory of the Koksokhim plant this way, the officer says. The main personnel of a separate rifle battalion were withdrawn from the territory of the plant on February 12-13, 2024. -It was planned to move the battalion to another part. Our command post remained in place there. But the situation turned out to be such that we received a command to leave. On the 15th, we left in small groups of five - there were 24 of us. Then we were picked up by cars and taken to Myrnograd,- said the soldier. According to him, at that time they went out on foot in an unknown area, under constant fire and between mines. Then, in two days, he counted almost 250 KABs on the territory of the plant - enemy planes were in the air almost constantly. Captain Marchenko managed to get out without injuries. However, he admits, there were many concussions - no one counted them in those conditions. Although it was difficult, says the soldier, he held on to the belief that everything would be fine. He kept in touch with relatives thanks to the Internet. They also encouraged each other with their brothers who were nearby. From Myrnograd, the unit was taken to Cherkasy region for recovery. Yuriy was treated after the concussions he received and later underwent a medical examination and, according to its findings, was deemed unfit for service in combat units. He took up the relationship and already in April returned to his native Fourth Department of the Kremenchug TCC and SP in the Kozel region. Headed the documentation support group. Works with documents, deals with personnel issues and material support. Emphasizes that in order to win against a strong enemy, the Armed Forces of Ukraine need a motivated replenishment. -If not for us, men, to protect our Motherland, then who? Otherwise, the enemy will come here very quickly - to Poltava region. We have already seen how quickly he can advance when unopposed. I understand how important the work of territorial recruitment centers is in matters of replenishment of the Defense Forces. However, I also see the information press that today goes against the TCC. Because the task of the enemy is to disrupt the mobilization to the ranks of the Armed Forces by all means. And these IPSOs not only scare civilian men, who as a result try to avoid mobilization in every possible way. This also demotivates the soldiers who fight for Ukraine - some of them for three or four years. Military personnel also need time to rest. But who will replace them? The only way out is to postpone all refusals and stand up for Ukraine to everyone,- noted Yuriy Marchenko. As reported by ArmyInform, about such as Serhiy, a fighter of the 81st Slobozhan Brigade, called -Phantom-, it is said that they were born in a shirt. All because the soldier survived after the rupture of an 82-mm mine a few steps away from him.

Title: Are there alternatives to Telegram, the Center for Countering Disinformation at the National Securit...
Description: It should be emphasized that it applies exclusively to military personnel, employees of state authorities and critical infrastructure enterprises, as well as employees of the security and defense sector. Is there a replacement for this popular messenger, do public authorities plan to switch to other popular platforms to disseminate information, and what safety rules should be followed when using messengers on the air of the national telethon Single News told Andriy Kovalenko, head of the Center for Combating Disinformation under the National Security and Defense Council of Ukraine. He said that the Anti-Disinformation Center has a Viber channel with almost half a million subscribers. There is also an option to create a channel in the WhatsApp messenger. However, the problem is that a significant number of people are used only to the Telegram messenger, with the help of which it is convenient for them to receive information, so it is uncomfortable for them to switch to some new platforms. — This recommendation is not directly related to banning Telegram itself. Other solutions are needed if we are going to talk about any restrictions on Telegram as a means of receiving news in the future, Andriy Kovalenko emphasized. According to him, at the moment there is no question of the refusal of state authorities to run their own channels in Telegram. Also, those persons whose positions involve the need to do so will be able to use Telegram from work devices. Instead, consider using other messengers like Signal, WhatsApp, Threema, etc. for personal communication. At the same time, it is necessary to take care of personal safety and, if possible, completely refuse to send personal data, documents, photos through any messengers. It is also necessary to have strong passwords for all accounts in social networks. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that servicemen were banned from using Telegram on official duty. devices and explained why the military was banned from using the messenger. ArmyInform also wrote, that not so with Telegram and why information from Telegram - garbage poisons consciousness, and also informed, how the actions of French law enforcement officers against the founder of the popular messenger will help counter Russian aggression.

And it comes to the point that our drones don't just overheat the rotors or batteries, it overheats by itself and I don't want to take off anymore,- he said. However, units of the 72nd OMBr inflict maximum damage on the enemy, the enemy suffered huge losses. -But he steps over the heads of his own scum and continues to try to surround Ugledar with renewed strength. If you look at the city from a bird's eye view, then there is one solid haze around. Houses, farms, plantations, fields are burning,- he said.

Title: Telegram can track movement even when geolocation is turned off - NSDO
Description: The head of the Center for countering disinformation under the National Security and Defense Council of Ukraine told about this on the air of the national telethon -Edyni news- href=-https://youtu.be/j5TqaWCCdUg-> Andriy Kovalenko. -Few people know, for example, that Telegram can track movement even when geolocation is turned off,- he said. The head of the CSDP of the NSDC explained that such a function theoretically allows whoever controls the messenger to track the movements and whereabouts of any person who may be of potential interest. There is no zero chance that Telegram is controlled or accessed by Russian intelligence or other secret services of the occupiers. — We do not know 100% whether Russian intelligence has access and whether Durov is an agent or not an agent of Russian intelligence or whether he will cooperate. No one will give a guarantee, but the risk that your route will be with the enemy is quite high, explained Andriy Kovalenko. He noted that the risks of the Telegram messenger are not sufficiently known to users and poorly communicated in society, which massively uses this platform for news and personal communication. — The head of the State Security Agency, Kyrylo Budanov, constantly clearly says that Telegram poses a threat to national security. Because when the enemy can track your movement very simply using his actual messenger, which can be a tool for his intelligence, this is a threat. Therefore, such dangers must be voiced, the head of the Center for Combating Disinformation emphasized. Andriy Kovalenko also explained the reason why the ban on the use of Telegram on official devices and for sending official information to servicemen and employees of the security and defense sector, employees of state authorities and critical infrastructure enterprises caused a sharp reaction from society. — In my opinion, all because of the fact that now more than 70% of people consume news from Telegram channels. Accordingly, a large enough population is there, he said. In view of this, it is necessary to communicate more actively and explain the risks, threats and consequences that may arise from using the Telegram messenger. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that servicemen were banned from using Telegram on official duty. devices and explained why the military was banned from using the messenger. ArmyInform also wrote, that not so with Telegram and why information from Telegram - garbage poisons consciousness, and also informed, how the actions of French law enforcement officers against the founder of the popular messenger will help counter Russian aggression.

Title: In Transcarpathia, a combatant was detained who, for a bribe, left the military to serve in the rear

Title: In honor of the queen from Ukraine: Norwegians from -ELLISEV- train Ukrainian soldiers in Great Brit...
Description: Photos from the exercises within the multinational training operation Interflex on the territory of Great Britain were made public in the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Operation ELLISEV is a general term for Norway's military support to Ukraine. The operation got its name in honor of the eldest daughter of Yaroslav the Wise - Princess Elizaveta Yaroslavna of Kyiv, who was the wife and queen of the Norwegian king Harald the Severe. In Norway, she was called Ellisev. Each of their Norwegian military courses is carefully designed to provide the Ukrainian military with all the necessary skills for effective combat operations. Training programs include comprehensive training that includes tactics, grenade throwing, mine detection and disposal, trench assault, fire training, evacuation of the wounded and much more. Our military also trains to respond to drone attacks and enemy actions at any time of the day and under any weather conditions. Under the guidance of Norwegian instructors, they practice all possible scenarios of events on the battlefield in order to be ready for any challenges. Norway, which joined this initiative in October 2022, is actively training our defenders to fight for the freedom and independence of Ukraine. In addition to training, Norway makes a significant contribution to Ukraine's victory over Russian aggression. It supplies anti-aircraft missiles, artillery ammunition, and funds critical public functions such as energy, health care, and more. -Norway provides Ukraine with military equipment so that it can better protect its people and territory. Among other things, Norway transferred artillery, armored vehicles, tanks and demining equipment. Together with Great Britain, we are leading a coalition to help Ukraine build up its coastal and maritime defenses. The training of Ukrainian soldiers has been a key component of our military support, and Norwegian Armed Forces instructors are currently conducting training in the UK, Germany and Lithuania, as well as in Norway,- said Norwegian Defense Minister Bjorn Arild Gram. -Norway's support for Ukraine ranges from the donation of air defense missiles to the provision of funds to pay teachers' salaries. Our contributions are important both for Ukraine's struggle for self-defense and for the everyday life of Ukrainians. Our support for Ukraine is a long-term commitment that is unanimously supported by the Storting. Russia's war against Ukraine is the greatest challenge to security policy of our time. The Ukrainian people are fighting for their survival and freedom. Their struggle for self-defense is also our struggle - for democratic values ​​and European security. That is why Norway will continue to support Ukraine,- said Norwegian Prime Minister Jonas Haar Støre. Previously, ArmyInform showed photos from the exercises of the -Si Bryz- series in Bulgaria.

Title: Prisoners of war were mocked during the repeated Russian offensive on Kharkiv region: two occupiers ...
Description: This is reported by the SBU on September 24. This time it is about the occupiers: -In May-June of this year, both figures took part in the repeated offensive of the Rashists on Kharkiv. During the fighting in the Staritsa village of Chuguyiv district, Kiprin and his subordinate, together with three accomplices, captured four Ukrainian soldiers,- the report says. During the escorting of bound prisoners of war, the perpetrators beat them, knocked them off their feet, simulated execution by firing shots next to their heads. -Kiprin recorded all the tortures on the camera of his mobile phone, and then posted this video on the Internet. After documenting the war crimes committed by the Russian Federation and conducting relevant examinations, an evidentiary base was formed on both involved parties,- the SBU said. On the basis of these materials, the investigators of the Security Service notified Kiprin and Kuchmanov of suspicion under part 2 of Art. 28 and part 1 of Art. 438 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (violation of the laws and customs of war, committed by a group of persons following a prior conspiracy). Comprehensive measures are currently underway to bring both Russians to justice. The Security Service of Ukraine emphasizes the inevitability of punishment for crimes against Ukrainians. Title: The Lyman direction became the leader in terms of the number of enemy attacks — the General Staff of...
Description: Operational information as of 16:00 on September 24 was published by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Today, the border villages of Khotin and Korshachyna of the Sumy region were hit by rockets from the territory of the Russian Federation (probably the occupiers used S-300 air defense missiles). At the same time, enemy artillery and mortar fire in Kharkiv Oblast, Chernihiv Oblast, and Sumy Oblast affected the communities of settlements, in particular, Sopych, Velyka Pysarivka, Luhivka, Ugroydy, Brusky, Timofiivka, Iskryskiv Oblast, and Bilopillia. In addition, the Russians carried out airstrikes with anti-aircraft missiles in the areas of Malushyny, Richok, Yastrubyny, Sosnivka, Kindrativka, Pavlivka, Novaya Sloboda and the city of Sumy. In the Kharkiv direction, the enemy is trying to storm the positions of our units in the Vovchansk area. At the same time, residential areas and civil infrastructure of the city of Kharkiv were hit by guided aerial bombs. In the Kupyansk direction, the Russian occupiers attacked the Defense Forces seven times in the areas of Andriivka, Lozova and Stelmakhivka. Two clashes are still ongoing. Enemy aircraft attacked Petropavlivka with sixteen NARs. In the Lyman direction, the invading army carried out 15 attacks on Ukrainian positions during the day near the settlements of Druzhelyubivka, Grekivka, Cherneshchyna, Nevske, Torske and Novosadove. Ten battles have ended, five more are ongoing. Ukrainian soldiers steadfastly hold the defense and inflict losses on the enemy. In the Kramatorsk direction, since the beginning of the day, units of the Defense Forces repelled nine attacks by Russian invaders near Mynkivka, Kalynyvka, Bila Hora and Stupochky. Five enemy assaults are still ongoing. The occupiers' aircraft attacked Andriivka with NARA. In the Toretsk direction, the aggressor tried seven times to penetrate our defenses in the areas of Toretsk and Shcherbynivka settlements. Five clashes are still ongoing. The enemy actively uses aviation. In the Pokrovsky direction, the Russian invaders made 15 attempts to dislodge our defenders from their positions in the Vozdvizhenka, Novotoretsk, Novogrodivka, Krasny Yar, Marynivka, and Mykolaivka districts. The defense forces restrained the onslaught and repelled 13 enemy attacks, two skirmishes are still ongoing. In the direction of Kurakhiv, the enemy army attacked 12 times in the direction of the settlements of Tsukuryne, Zhelanne Druge, Georgiivka, Dalnye and Kostyantynivka. Nine attempts by the occupiers to advance have already been repulsed. Four enemy attacks continue in the direction of Vremivka in the direction of Pavlivka, Vodyanyi and Ugledar. In the Gulyaipil direction, the Russian invaders fired at the NARAs of Biloghirya. There are no significant changes in the rest of the directions. The operation is ongoing in the Kursk region. Enemy aviation continues to destroy their villages and cities. Since the beginning of the day, Russian planes have carried out six strikes with nine anti-aircraft missiles on their own territory. As reported by ArmyInform, during the past day at the front 143 combat clashes took place.

Title: Training of the Sea Breeze series was successfully conducted in Bulgaria

The diving teams of the participating countries of -Sea Breeze 2024.2- demonstrated their skills and had the opportunity to get acquainted with the unique experience of Ukrainian divers. The participants of the event spent two weeks in a friendly atmosphere, practicing underwater descents, searching for mine-like objects and their destruction with the help of modern underwater drones or divers. The ever-present team spirit of the multinational crews was felt despite the heat, wind and rain. Ukrainian specialists were also evaluated during the training, which is a very important stage on the path of the Armed Forces of Ukraine to compatibility with the member countries of the North Atlantic Alliance. Upon acquiring a sufficient level of interoperability, servicemen of the Ukrainian Navy will have the opportunity to perform joint tasks with units of NATO member countries. The topic of water demining exercises is very relevant in the realities of the modern war waged by the Russian Federation against Ukraine. Unfortunately, the level of mine danger still remains high in the Azov-Black Sea basin. That is why the Ukrainian Navy pays a lot of attention to this aspect of the training of its units. As reported by ArmyInform, NATO ordered drone robots to neutralize mines.

Title: The Ministry of Defense renews the appointment of managers of its enterprises on a competitive basis
Description: About this informs September 24 Ministry of Defense. -This decision actually returns the competitive selection for positions in the enterprises of the Ministry of Defense. Yesterday, the selection task force began its work. In this way, we will be able to attract professional and honest managers to the formation of development strategies, management and supervision of the management of our enterprises,- said Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine Stanislav Hayder. According to him, the result of this decision will be a better satisfaction of the needs of the Defense Forces in the conditions of war. For the period of martial law, the mandatory holding of competition for the positions of managers, heads of executive bodies of state-owned enterprises has been suspended, with certain exceptions. The decision of the Ministry of Defense will apply exclusively to enterprises under the operational control of the Ministry of Defense and is aimed at ensuring a transparent determination of applicants for management positions. The working group will determine and approve the criteria for evaluating candidates for these positions for each enterprise separately. At the same time, the selection of candidates will take place on the basis of transparency of evaluation criteria and requirements for the position, openness of competition announcements. -It is also envisaged to involve a professional recruiting company in the selection procedure and to invite representatives of international organizations, diplomatic institutions, and the expert environment to participate in the meetings of the selection working group,- the message reads. Conducting selection procedures for enterprise managers complies with the principles of corporate governance of the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development. It is expected that the decision will promote the trust of civil society and partners in the decisions of the Ministry of Defense as an effective owner of state-owned enterprises. As reported by ArmyInform, Deputy Minister of Defense Oleksandr Balanutsa called on Spain protydiyi-novym-atakam-rf/->accelerate the supply of tanks and air defense systems against the background of the aggressor country's preparation for new large-scale attacks.

Title: Night voyage on the Danube: the border guards detained the boat crew in the reeds

The department said that the men planned to cross the Danube to Romania from a place covered with reeds so that they would not be noticed. The detainees were 24- and 39-year-old residents of Izmail district, as well as a 33-year-old resident of Donetsk region. Protocols were drawn up for the entire -ship team- according to Art. 204-1 of the Criminal Procedure Code -Illegal crossing or attempted illegal crossing of the state border of Ukraine- and Article 202 of the Criminal Procedure Code -Violation of the border regime-. The persons involved in their illegal journey are being identified. ArmyInform reminds that it is better not to break the law, but to use the aggregator of vacancies in the Armed Forces or recruiting centers.

Title: He tortured Ukrainian patriots: an ex-employee of the occupation prison in Kherson was exposed

After the de-occupation of Kherson, the enemy henchman remained in the city and hid from justice for a long time, practically not appearing in public. Title: Taboo on Telegram in the service: why the military was forbidden to use the messenger
Description: About why such a decision was made, the head of the Center for Combating Disinformation told on the air of the national telethon -Edyni news- Andriy Kovalenko of the National Security and Defense Council of Ukraine. — Guarantees could never be given regarding the telegram, where the information is stored after your correspondence, even if you deleted the correspondence with another person. Some of the Telegram servers are still located on the territory of Russia, some of the servers are previously located in Dubai. Accordingly, it is not known whether Russian special services control these servers or have access to them or not, he said. The fact that correspondence is stored on external servers could be noticed by anyone who changed smartphones and then logged into his account from another smartphone. - Documents and files that you sent to another person are pulled, if you have not cleared the correspondence with them. This information is stored directly. Andriy Kovalenko explained that the use of Telegram as a messenger is not for reading news, but rather for communication as a messenger by people who work for the state as military personnel. From the overview, this is about the prohibition of sending official documents in Telegram and communicating in this messenger about official matters. As early as 2022, the military stopped using Telegram, switching mainly to Signal and WhatsApp. — As for the use for official purposes, such as running official telegram channels of state bodies, it is not prohibited, explained the head of the Center for Countering Disinformation of the National Security Council of Ukraine. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that servicemen were banned from using Telegram on official duty. devices, explained what's wrong with Telegram and why information from telegram junk poisons consciousness, and also noted, how the actions of French law enforcement officers against the founder of the popular messenger will help counter Russian aggression.

Title: Maidan cases: ex-chiefs of the SBU and 20 high-ranking officials of the FSB of the Russian Federatio...
Description: About this informs September 24 Office of the Prosecutor General. They are accused of carrying out subversive activities against Ukraine, taking actions aimed at inciting national enmity and hatred in Ukraine, illegally obstructing protest actions in 2013-2014. -Among the defendants is an army general, the former head of the security service of the President of the Russian Federation, the deputy commander-in-chief of the internal forces and 5 other generals who held senior positions in the FSB of the Russian Federation,- the report says. The investigation established that in December 2013, to implement a joint decision of the then heads of the SBU and FSB of the Russian Federation, 20 employees of the Russian special service came to Ukraine. FSB employees were housed in the buildings of the SBU and, with the support of the former head of the department, his deputy and the head of the department, organized the creation of provocative videos. -They created a YouTube channel, through which more than 250 videos were distributed to the Internet and the media. They discredited socio-political events in Ukraine and humiliated Ukrainians as a nation in general,- the law enforcement officers noted. Thus, during the investigation in criminal proceedings regarding crimes committed in connection with mass protests in 2013-2014, the direct influence of the Russian special services on the former leadership of the Ukrainian special services with the aim of joint subversive activities against Ukraine and inciting national enmity and hatred was established . The former head of the SBU and the head of the SBU Department will also be tried for collaborative activity - voluntarily taking positions in 2022 in the -security organs- of the aggressor state of the Russian Federation, illegally formed in the temporarily occupied territories of Ukraine. -Since the accused are hiding from law enforcement agencies and are on international wanted list, a special pre-trial investigation (in absentia) was conducted in relation to them,- noted the Prosecutor General's Office. As reported by ArmyInform, law enforcement officers reported the suspicions of a group of persons, in particular the commanders of -Berkut-, under the circumstances of the organization of illegal obstruction of protest actions on the night of February 18-19, 2014 in the central part of the city of Kyiv.

Title: Pointed Russian missiles at his brigade and was preparing to flee to the Russian Federation: a resid...
Description: About this informs September 24 SBU.
