Title: -Wings- with artificial intelligence: automatically bringing the enemy to destruction should be scal...
Description: About this on the air of the national telethon -Edyny Novyny- told the commander of the BPAK shock battalion -Achilles- of the 92nd separate assault brigade named after the basket captain Ivan Sirk, captain Yuriy Fedorenko. — The state of Ukraine has made extremely strong progress in terms of the development, production and combat use of a number of drones, in particular the long-range -wing- type, he said. The military said that it is gradually possible to saturate Ukrainian units with such UAVs along the entire line of combat. — At the beginning of 2023, these tools were used exclusively by individual divisions. It was effective enough, but not as intense as the demands of the front required. Corresponding improvements were made, and most units of the Defense Forces today effectively use wing-type strike weapons, the Achilles commander said. He explained the benefits of AI-equipped drones. - Equipping with artificial intelligence - automatic proofing in this case - makes it possible to bypass the enemy's electronic warfare and, when capturing the target, enter it clearly. In this way, the effectiveness of the application increases many times, the officer said. He emphasized that such UAVs make it possible to destroy valuable enemy equipment, the loss of which not only costs the occupiers financially, but also critically undermines their combat capabilities. This deprives the occupiers of forces and means to conduct hostilities and, accordingly, helps save the lives of Ukrainian defenders. — They preserve life, give the opportunity to knock out, in particular, the enemy's anti-aircraft defenses. This is extremely important, because the less the enemy has anti-aircraft means, the more opportunities for our intelligence to fly further, said the military. Thanks to this, it is possible to detect the enemy on the distant approaches to his advanced positions in the deep rear. — The more we destroy the enemy in the areas of their accumulation, the less of them will reach the front line. These -wings- objectively make it possible to perform such a task at the expense of destroying anti-aircraft defenses, the commander of the Ukrainian drones explained. He noted that in this way it is possible to effectively destroy the occupiers, including across the line of the state border of Ukraine on the territory of the Russian Federation. ArmyInform previously reported that syurpryzy/->Ukrainian drones promise the enemy new unpleasant surprises for him already in the spring of next year.

Title: Where and how buffer zones have already been created: foreign experience
Description: What are buffer zones, how they were used during conflicts between other countries and whether they can guarantee security, ArmiyaInform tells. Zones created with the purpose of separating one territory from another are called buffer zones. In international relations, they are most often represented in the form of demilitarized zones. This is done with the sole purpose of stopping the killings and the possibility of striking neighboring territories. This practice is not new. Yes, after a series of wars, or as they were shamefully called in the international community, conflicts, such zones were created. On July 27, 1953, North and South Korea signed an armistice agreement and established a demilitarized zone along the entire border (248 km), 2 km wide on each side. On both sides of the zone there are minefields and there are significant groups of troops. On May 31, 1974, after the October 1973 war, better known as Doomsday War, a UN Security Council resolution created a 75 km long demilitarized zone near the Golan Heights between Israel and Syria. The UN mission monitors the territory's buffer status to this day. On August 16, 1974, after the end of hostilities between Cyprus and Turkey, a UN Security Council decision created a buffer zone 180 km long and up to 7 km wide, separating the Republic of Cyprus from the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus. The UN mission monitors the ceasefire regime. On March 26, 1979, Egypt and Israel signed a peace treaty, according to which the Sinai Peninsula became a buffer zone where the deployment of armed forces was limited. On April 3, 1991, following Operation Desert Storm, the UN Security Council established a demilitarized zone along the border between Iraq and Kuwait. The zone is surrounded by barbed wire and is 200 km long. Until 2003, a UN mission was stationed in this zone. So, as we can see, the creation of such zones in some cases managed to stop the bloodshed. At one time, Israel was able to establish silence on the northern border for a while. It was in the 1980s, after the so-called First Lebanon War in 1982. In the late 1970s, the north of Israel became the target of continuous Palestinian terrorist attacks. Palestinian terrorists who infiltrated from the territory of Lebanon committed large-scale terrorist attacks in Israel - taking hostages and killing 21 schoolchildren in Maalota, an attack on bus passengers on the Tel Aviv - Haifa highway, which led to the killing of 38 Israelis. From the territory of Lebanon, the Palestinians, using MLRS received from the USSR, continuously bombarded the northern regions of Israel. An independent terrorist -republic- emerged on the territory of Lebanon, which is directly adjacent to the Israeli border, and was named after the main Palestinian terrorist organization -Fatahland-. Terrorist leader Yasser Arafat took advantage of the civil war in Lebanon and effectively seized power in the border areas. Tens of thousands of terrorists were concentrated in Arafat's territory of Lebanon, in numerous camps and training centers gang formations continued to be trained for further attacks on Israel, huge arsenals were created. Arming, training and political cover for Arafat's terrorists was led by the USSR. The Kremlin hoped, with the help of Arafat, to expand its influence in the Arab world, which was greatly shaken after the total defeat of the satellites of the USSR - Syria and Egypt in the wars of 1967 and 1973, and therefore did not skimp: a stream of Soviet weapons went to the Palestinians: tanks, artillery, small arms. According to the German magazine Spiegel, the Soviet weapons received by the Palestinians would be enough to arm a 500,000-strong army. The chief military advisor to the Syrian Defense Minister was Colonel-General Hryhoriy Yashkin, who arrived in Syria from the position of Deputy Commander-in-Chief of the Group of Soviet Forces in Germany. Thousands of Soviet officers were at all levels of command of the Syrian troops, from batteries and companies to the Syrian Ministry of Defense. Syrian troops under the command of Soviet military advisers occupied strategically important areas of Lebanon. The final straw that broke Israel's patience was the assassination of Israeli ambassador to Great Britain, Shlomo Argov, by Palestinian terrorists on June 3, 1982, after which he miraculously survived but was left disabled. -Shlom al-Galil- (Peace of Galilee) - that's how the General Staff of the IDF called the operation of Israeli forces in Lebanon, which began on June 6, 1982. During the lightning operation of the Israeli Air Force, almost all Soviet air defense systems and dozens of aircraft were destroyed. The ground operation also achieved its goal. The Israeli victory also marked the technical backwardness of Soviet weapons, which were significantly inferior to Israeli and American weapons, as well as combat technologies, and, in addition, showed all the viciousness of Soviet air warfare tactics and the construction of air defense systems. After the end of hostilities, a certain strip of South Lebanon remained under Israeli control - the IDF (Israel Defense Forces - Author) retained control over a 19-kilometer (12-mile) buffer zone, which was held, in particular, with the help of the pro-Israeli South Lebanon Army (SLA). In 1985, Hezbollah, a Lebanese radical Shiite movement sponsored by Iran, called for an armed struggle to end Israel's occupation of Lebanese territory. When the civil war in Lebanon ended and other rival groups agreed to disarm, Hezbollah refused to do so. Fighting with Hezbollah weakened Israel's resolve and led to the withdrawal of Israeli troops from Lebanon in 2000. But the truce did not last long - in 2006, the Second Lebanon War began, after which Hezbollah suffered significant losses, and the border was quiet for a while. But now, after the operation in Gaza, launched in October 2023 on the northern border, shelling continues again. Since the escalation of the conflict, more than 60,000 people have been evacuated from Israeli border towns and settlements inland. According to the data of the international organization Organization for Migration, which keeps records of migration flows in the world, approximately 90,000 residents from the Lebanese side left their homes in the south of the country. Hezbollah began using Burkan missiles against Israel, which can carry up to 500 kilograms of explosives and have a range of 800 to 1,200 kilometers, depending on the modification. According to many analysts, another war is only a matter of time. So, as we can see, the creation of buffer zones does not always guarantee safety.

Title: The Ministry of Defense reported how much Ukrainian land was demined in 2.5 years
Description: The course of demining work was discussed at a meeting of the National Authority for Mine Action under the chairmanship of the First Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine, Lieutenant General Ivan Gavrylyuk, reports MOU. The event was attended by representatives of the Ministries of Defense, Internal Affairs, Economy, Reintegration of Temporarily Occupied Territories, the State Labor Service, the State Emergency Service, other departments and enterprises dealing with mine action issues. The participants of the meeting discussed the implementation of the Plan for humanitarian demining of the de-occupied territories of Ukraine for 2024 and the Plan for surveying agricultural lands for explosive objects. Since the beginning of the year, a non-technical survey has been carried out in 59 territorial communities, 235 square kilometers have been identified as possibly contaminated. Currently, humanitarian demining is carried out on 282 sites with a total area of ​​17.5 square kilometers, of which 88 sites with a total area of ​​7.23 square kilometers have already been transferred to territorial communities. In addition, according to the Action Plan for the clearance of explosive objects, 2,059 square kilometers of agricultural lands were surveyed and demined. It was possible to return this territory to productive use. -According to the results of the initial non-technical survey of the territories affected by explosive objects, their area decreased from 156,000 to 142,000 square kilometers,- Ivan Gavrilyuk said. Members of the National Mine Action Authority decided to form a consolidated position of Ukraine for participation in the 5th review conference of the Convention -On the Prohibition of the Use, Stockpiling, Production and Transfer of Anti-Personnel Mines and Their Destruction.- In addition, the head of the Secretariat of the National Authority for Mine Action, Colonel Ruslan Beregulya, who heads the Main Department of Mine Action, Civil Defense and Environmental Security, announced the start of work on demining plans for 2025. Attention was also paid to demining the Ukrainian sea. It is planned that Ukraine will receive three more demining ships next year. We currently have two of these. In addition, the effectiveness of demining the maritime territory increased thanks to the support of Germany, which transferred special equipment for the detection and classification of explosive objects. As reported by ArmyInform, the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine invited Bulgaria to join the international demining coalition.

Title: NATO anti-drone training: Ukraine took part for the first time
Description: This was reported by the NATO press service. From September 10 to 20, more than 450 participants from 19 NATO member states and three partner countries gathered in the Netherlands to test the ability of commercially available counter-drone systems to work together. During NATO's annual C-UAS Technical Interoperability Exercise, more than 60 counter-drone systems and technologies, such as sensors, drone guidance systems, jammers and cyber interceptors, were tested in real-world conditions. Ukraine's first active participation in these exercises is part of the Ukraine-NATO Innovative Cooperation Roadmap, approved by the leaders of the Alliance countries and Ukraine at the Washington Summit. -Exercises such as C-UAS TIE provide a unique opportunity to jointly address pressing issues such as the autonomy and interoperability of drones, as well as to study Ukraine's combat experience in combating small unmanned aerial vehicles,- the statement said. The integration of counter-drone technologies into NATO's Integrated Air and Missile Defense (IAMD) is essential to strengthening the Alliance's deterrence and defense capabilities. At the 2024 Washington Summit, Allies took steps to further improve the readiness, response and integration of NATO's IAMD and agreed to support the development and implementation of an integrated air and missile defense architecture for Ukraine. As ArmiyaInform reported, the chiefs of general staffs of the armed forces of NATO countries held a meeting in Prague on September 13-15 to implement the decisions of the Washington Summit and discuss how The Alliance will strengthen deterrence and defense while increasing support for Ukraine.

Title: The enemy's factory of fakes has been exposed: what the enemy is lying about
Description: Media workers received a leak of internal documents of the -Social Design Agency-, which works on behalf of the administration of the President of the Russian Federation and created almost 40,000 units of fake content in 4 months of 2024. Serhiy Kiriyenko, the first deputy head of the administration of the President of Russia, is called the curator of the agency's activities. Among the fake documents, in particular, a document allegedly from the Ukrainian Ministry of Defense was found: the order of the Deputy Ministry of Defense N. Kalmykova to the heads of units and departments of the Armed Forces not to confirm - information about the presence of prisoners of war for exchange on board- Il-76, which crashed in the Belgorod region of Russia in January 2024, and fake quotes from representatives of the IOU about the -insignificance of these losses-. The purpose of these fakes, according to the accompanying documents, is to accuse the Ukrainian military leadership of censorship and concealment of the truth about the disaster. In fact, the Il-76 was transporting S-300 missiles, which Russia uses to fire at Ukraine. And Russia used this incident to sow discontent among Ukrainians and undermine Western aid to our country. Also, in the -register of fakes and falsehoods- there is a forgery of the alleged order of the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces Oleksandr Syrskyi equating the capture of military personnel with treason . The purpose of this fake, as stated in the description of the task of the Russian agency, is -discrediting the military-political leadership of Ukraine and demoralizing the Armed Forces of Ukraine-. In addition, among the agency's -accomplished tasks- are fake quotes from Oleksandr Syrskyi, manipulation of the population points and regions from which the fighters of the Ukrainian Armed Forces are allegedly called up the most. To split Ukrainian society, the Kremlin fakers actively used the difficult relationship between Volodymyr Zelenskyi and his predecessor Poroshenko, the mayor of Kyiv Klitschko, as well as the former commander-in-chief of the Ukrainian Armed Forces Zaluzhny. span> For according to the editor and presenter of Radio Liberty's -Schemes- project Nataliya Sedletska, this investigation is unique in that it exposes and documents in detail how thousands of fakes about the war in Ukraine were created, aimed both at Western audiences states, as well as Ukrainians. Some of them were shared by influential people and were even taken seriously.

Title: What awaits Ukraine in winter: an expert on the Kremlin's missile and drone terror
Description: Military expert Petro Chernyk told ArmiyaInform about this: -In a strategic sense, I do not think that this winter will be anything unique in terms of tactics from the Russians, especially missile and drone attacks. Yes, they somewhat managed to raise the total number of missile strikes. The last missile salvo by the enemy, which took place in August, was 127 missiles. I will decipher it, why you should not look in the direction of some absolute disaster, because they say that this is the biggest blow. Yes, he is the biggest. The previous one was in December of last year and had 102 missiles then. That is, they raised (rocket volley — Ed.) to 25 rockets. But if you take a calculator and multiply the carriers with which they can strike, then they have at least 20 Tu-95MS aircraft. And they can take on board up to eight Kh-101 missiles, so we already have 80 missiles. The Russian Federation has up to ten missile carriers of various classes in the Black Sea. For example, small missile ships of the type -Buyan-M-, -Karakurt- and the patrol ship -Vasiliy Bykov- are equipped with Kalibr missile systems. The Russians also have two more operational frigates of the Admiral Gorshkov type. Each carrier ship can carry eight missiles. If we add missiles from Tu-95 aircraft and ships, then we already have up to 160 missiles. Of course, there are also Iskander-M launchers and S-300 complexes, which the enemy has switched to surface-to-surface mode of operation. Let's add the coastal missile complexes -Bastion- and -Val-, etc. That is, if you put everything together, the enemy theoretically should have, well, at least 300-400 missiles. And what is not? And it won't. Why? The occupiers are at the highest point of missile production. Since they started somewhere in the middle of 2023 to produce 120-130 missiles per month, a maximum of 140, they are standing still. They cannot produce more. Indeed, in August of this year, the use of an abnormal number of Shahed drones, almost 800, was recorded. But even for this indicator, they will no longer come out. That is, as these last volleys took place, so they will continue to be. The hit rate on our side for -shaheeds- sometimes even reaches 100%, for rockets varies from 85 to 95 percent. These are very high figures. Good news for us. If until the middle of last summer, even autumn, the Americans produced 20-21 missiles for the Patriot air defense system, then it has already been confirmed that in August of this year they produced plus 20 missiles. And this is already 40 pieces per month. And production will increase. That is, our covering of the sky will increase. Germany will transfer 17 new IRIS-T systems to strengthen Ukraine's air defense. This is a strengthened division, it is very good. Let me remind you that the IRIS-T complex has an impressive accuracy rate of 95 percent. Each launcher has 8 missiles. That is, 10 systems - 80 missiles. Finally, we have F-16 planes. They have a unique AIM-9 Sidewinder missile on board. It is an American air-to-air missile with a short range of up to 20 kilometers. By the way, this is the most massive air-to-air missile in the world. More than 200 thousand of them were produced. Spain has announced that it will send to Ukraine a complete battery of the Hawk anti-aircraft missile system, which contains 6 launchers. One launcher is three missiles, the radius of application is up to 40 kilometers. Again, this is the most massive rocket that exists in the world in this class. More than 40 thousand of them were produced. We have to look carefully at this winter, of course there will be difficulties. The winter will not be easy, because our energy infrastructure is destroyed by 40-50 percent. But the absolute disaster that our enemy is counting on will not happen either. Why? After all, we get more than half of the electricity generation from nuclear power plants. Plus there is good news - this is the construction of another nuclear power plant in Ukraine. This is a powerful answer. Let's add here the so-called small generating capacities. Starting from the mass installation of electric solar panels and wind turbines and ending with ordinary generators for own households and institutions.

Title: What is the new DOT-Chain system and how to use it: step-by-step instructions
Description: Among other things, the quality of execution of combat tasks by units, and the motivation of personnel, and globally, national security in general, depend on the speed, efficiency, quality of the supply of products to military units and the complete absence of a corruption component during these processes. So, a week ago, another digital product for the military was launched in Ukraine. On September 11, the State rear operator presented DOT-Chain, an innovative IT system for managing the rear needs of the Armed Forces. This IT system from the State operator of the rear should fundamentally change the processes of providing food to the Armed Forces. The system digitizes key processes: from product orders to invoice processing, thereby reducing delivery times by four. So now all the stages, from the application filled out by the head of food service to the payment to the supplier, are collected in one place. All necessary documentation and signatures of each of the parties are also collected in one place. Creation of DOT-Chain has become the largest digital project in DOT. A team of IT specialists of the State Rear Operator worked on the development for half a year. The Ministry assures that this innovative solution will be able to completely eradicate corruption. The budget for rear support of the Armed Forces currently amounts to 96 billion hryvnias. DOT-Chain's primary mission is to simplify processes, increase awareness, and strengthen support for both the military and suppliers. During the presentation of the system, Alyona Zhuzha, the IT advisor of the State Rear Operator, responsible for the project development, says the following about the key advantage: — After everyone learns to use the system and we work out all the processes in it, it is expected that we will be able to do even more reduce delivery time. Before that, 30,000 paper documents were generated to provide food for one military unit. This is just one week of one military unit. There is no need for that now. According to her, from now on the system shows all the statuses of procurement and delivery documents, and expense invoices are immediately uploaded to the system. At the same time, the State operator of the rear, having electronic signatures from the military unit and the supplier, can immediately pay the application. Information from the system will also be used by the Ministry of Defense to adjust the needs of the military in accordance with the data. See in detail in the video instructions step-by-step recommendations-tips on how to use the DOT-Chain system. At the moment, the functionality of the system extends only to food. In the future, it is promised to be scaled up for purchases of other categories of goods. — I'm sure that each of you has seen posts on social networks that somewhere there are problems with food, and somewhere the situation is critical. The DOT-Chain system allows us to understand exactly where the situation is in real time, to make decisions and take responsibility for what is happening on the ground, says the head of the State Rear Operator Arsen Zhumadilov. Changes brought by the DOT-Chain IT system:

Title: The roasting of Russian lice - a drone - dragon - worked in the Kharkiv region
Description: The video appeared on September 19 on the unit's channel. The FPV drone with thermite set fire to part of the landing with the positions of the occupants, after which the wooden roofs of the dugouts caught fire. -This is a very effective practice of smoking out enemies. It was hardly possible to destroy anyone with that fire, but personal belongings, ammunition, special equipment and many other interesting things were definitely burned by the fire of revenge. Having personally been in the burning landing, I can say that there is not much pleasant there, there is nowhere to look, it is simply impossible to breathe, and the eyes constantly sting and water from the smoke. So I'm sure that the orcs liked it),- commented the pilot of -Sharp Kartuz- on the video. As reported by ArmyInform, the drones of the -Sharp Kartuz- UAV unit of the National Guard of Ukraine were able to find and hit a well-hidden buggy of the Russians.

Title: Do not hide - our drones are destroying enemy equipment in shelters
Description: The video of combat work appeared on September 19 on the unit's channel. The crew of a fighter with the call sign Kolyvan found the invaders' hidden vehicles and equipment at night and destroyed the targets with accurate drops. As reported by ArmyInform, the pilots of the Khorne group unit of the 116th mechanized brigade showed fiery destruction of the Russian fortification.

Title: Next week, Volodymyr Zelenskyi will present the Victory Plan to Joseph Biden
Description: informs about thisSeptember 19, Office of the President. The head of state will hold bilateral talks with the leaders of countries and international organizations on the sidelines of the General Assembly. Volodymyr Zelenskyi will meet with US President Joseph Biden and present him with the Victory Plan. The head of the Ukrainian state expects to discuss the details of this Plan, as well as support from the United States in Ukraine's struggle for freedom. Volodymyr Zelenskyi also plans meetings with US Vice President Kamala Harris, representatives of the United States Congress from both parties and the 45th US President Donald Trump. As reported by ArmyInform, President Volodymyr Zelenskyi said that the Defense Forces of Ukraine managed to pro-kurskyj-napryamok/->reduce the assault potential of the occupier in Donetsk region.

Title: -Grad-, a tank and a lot of transport — drones from the ground defense set fire to the Pokrovsky dir...
Description: The video of combat operation appeared on September 19 on the unit's channel. Muramasa pilots note that the enemy is not stopping and moving forward. Sometimes he pauses to regroup and directs the main strike force towards the city of Kurakhove. During this pause, enemy aircraft and missiles destroy bridges and all important strategic objects of our cities. -At this time, we are working 24/7 to improve enemy logistics. It is not always possible to do this, there are many reasons. One of the essential ones is a powerful EW (both ours and the enemy's). But, despite this, we are good at cutting their logistics paths with drones,- the Muramasa pilots commented on their video. As reported by ArmyInform, the pilots of the Muramasa strike unmanned aerial vehicle complex company of the 109th separate brigade of the Armed Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine destroyed a large number of various enemy vehicles.

Title: And to the Russians -Stork- brings death - the harvest day of our -wing-
Description: The video appeared on September 19 on the channel of the command and artillery reconnaissance battery of the brigade. During the day, thanks to -Stork-, our defenders were able to impress: – RSZV BM-21 Grad; – a car and a truck; – 152-mm self-propelled gun -Msta-S-; – combat vehicle -Tiger-. As reported by ArmyInform, the battalion of unmanned systems (UAS) of the 110th separate mechanized brigade named after Colonel-General Mark Bezruchka practices the original method of combating reconnaissance aircraft of the Russian invaders.

Title: The Russians have a clown - our stormtroopers interrogated a captured traitor
Description: The video of the conversation appeared on September 19 on the battalion channel. The prisoner, a native of Donetsk, rose to the rank of lieutenant with the occupiers. -Before you is a typical character who in 2014 chose the path of treason and became part of the so-called -Ruskov measure-. Now, as a result, he is in our captivity. He is a traitor for Ukrainians and cannon fodder for Putin-oriented Russians! To be captured by stormtroopers is to draw a lucky ticket! Replenishment of the exchange fund, which our battalion constantly conducts, will certainly help in the return of our Heroes from Russian captivity!-, the battalion commented on the video. As reported by ArmyInform, during the fighting in Toretsk, the Bradley infantry fighting vehicle helped the fighters of the 425th Skala assault battalion to approach the high-rise building occupied by the enemy and clean her.

Title: Drones of the Defense Forces told when it is possible to overcome enemy EW
Description: An officer of the Separate Detachment of Special Purpose Unmanned Systems -Kryla- told about this on the air of the national telethon -Edyny Novyny- Omega- of the Special Purpose Center of the National Guard of Ukraine with the call sign -Storm-. He said that the Russian occupiers use various EW systems to suppress the control signals of Ukrainian drones. - Usually these are some mobile REBs in the form of backpacks. The infantry takes them for themselves, advances in a certain direction and tries to gain a foothold there, he said. However, such EW means require constant power supply, which is difficult to provide at the forward positions of the enemy. — Some logistics also work in them. They used their drones to deliver various batteries, food, so that their enemy force could hold out in a certain direction as long as possible. This is usually not very effective because constant power is required for these BERs. It can work for a certain time, and then, due to the fact that it is no longer working, it is possible to carry out various types of damage, the officer explained. At the same time, the enemy is also trying to strike Ukrainian defenders with the help of UAVs. — Recently, the number of applications of FPV drones has increased. But, taking into account the fact that we use REBs, their effectiveness drops to a minimum. In the same way, they are trying to calculate our EW system and use aerial reconnaissance drones. There are not so many of them in the directions, but they are also used, said the UAV operator. He emphasized that the fighters of the Defense Forces also do not stand still and use various types of EW as efficiently as possible to suppress enemy drones. Earlier, ArmyInform showed how Ukrainian drones destroy the enemy in Kharkiv Oblast in a variety of ways with the help of FPV, skids and -dragon- drones.

Title: About 40,000 Russian troops managed to be diverted - the President about the Kursk direction
Description: He said this in an evening address on September 19. -Today there was a lot of work with the military, with special services. The report of the Head of the Syrsky Committee, the report of the Foreign Intelligence Service, a meeting with the Minister of Defense of Ukraine and the head of the Security Service of Ukraine,- the head of state noted. According to him, they form the basis for detailed, thorough negotiations with partners. -The situation remains extremely difficult, heavy battles are taking place every day - Kurakhiv direction, Pokrovsky. But we do our best for the stability of our combat brigades. And a separate operation in the Kursk region. About 40,000 Russian troops have already been diverted in this direction,- he said. The President also noted that there is a replenishment of the exchange fund for Ukraine. -All these are important things that affect the overall situation of the war. I thank all our combat brigades, every soldier, sergeant, every commander for courage,- he summed up. As reported by ArmyInform, the MEPs urged to immediately remove all restrictions for of Ukraine on the use of Western weapons against legitimate military targets in Russia.

Title: Allowing Russia to be hit - the European Parliament adopted a corresponding resolution
Description: reported this on September 19 the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine, as it called the resolution of the European Parliament important and extremely relevant for support of Ukraine in the fight against Russian aggression. The European Parliament also called on the EU member states to: — fulfill the commitment from March 2023 regarding the supply of one million projectiles to Ukraine. — accelerate the supply of weapons, air defense systems and ammunition to Ukraine, including TAURUS missiles. — undertake to annually provide Ukraine with military support in the amount of at least 0.25% of its GDP. — increase sanctions pressure on Russia. -We are grateful to the newly elected European Parliament for supporting and advocating urgent decisions necessary for Ukrainian victory! We appreciate the decisive position and solidarity of each of the 425 MEPs who voted for the resolution,- said Olena Kondratyuk, Deputy Speaker of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine. The resolution of the European Parliament is not binding and is a declaration of the views of the MEPs. As reported by ArmyInform, a member of the European Parliament called on European countries to give Ukraine long-range missiles.

Title: During the day, snipers destroyed 20-40-50 people - company commander Serhiy Varakin
Description: The conversation with the officer was broadcast on September 19 on the channel of the -Return Alive- foundation. The most valuable thing for Serhii is his subordinates, whom he gently calls family. In March, Serhiy Varakin lost a soldier for the first time in 9 years of service, an enemy FPV hit one of the company's pickup trucks. -I always tried to hold back - I'm a man. But sometimes you can't help it: you stand and roar,- Serhiy explains. The war is changing, which forces Serhiy Varakin, as a commander, to resort to non-standard solutions. One of these is the mastery of kamikaze drones by snipers. -If we can't get the enemy from the ground, then we will get him from the sky,- says Serhiy Varakin. As reported by ArmyInform, a sniper of the 77th separate airmobile brigade of the Russian Air Force with the call sign -Wolf- told how to prepare and what is important during combat work.

Title: AK-74 for -noise isolation-: in Kharkiv Oblast, enemy soldiers are poorly trained and equipped
Description: An officer of the Separate Detachment of Special Purpose Unmanned Systems -Kryla- told about this on the air of the national telethon -Edyny Novyny- Omega- of the Special Purpose Center of the National Guard of Ukraine with the call sign -Storm-. — If we take the trend of combat training of infantrymen, then in recent times these are usually people who signed a contract six months to a year ago. Of course, they had some training, they were not immediately sent to the front, he said. However, the level of education of the occupiers is extremely low, they have not mastered even small arms. -In most cases, they just use weapons to make some noise isolation so that we think they are trained in something,- the officer explained. The occupiers are primarily armed with AK-74 assault rifles, but they also have newer weapons. - In terms of equipment, in most cases there were no special forces or military personnel with greater experience. These are ordinary infantrymen who serve literally up to a year. Therefore, in terms of skills, they have a very low level, the military said. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that during attacks in Vovchansk, the enemy steadily loses up to 70% of attack aircraft - barely a third survives.

Title: Our -raven- hunted the Russian -frog-
Description: The video appeared on September 19 on the Black Raven channel (in English it is -Black Raven-) . -The vile and despicable have no place on the holy Ukrainian land!-, the drones commented on the video. As reported by ArmyInform, an atmospheric selection of shots of the demotivation of Russian enemies-occupiers prepared by drone operators of the -Black Raven- battalion of the separate mechanized brigade -Kholodny Yar-.

Title: In one day today, Russian troops have already used almost 90 guided aerial bombs — the President
Description: The appeal was issued in the evening of September 19. -Rescue operations are currently underway in Sumy after a Russian bomb hit. Hitting a boarding house for the elderly. According to currently available information, there were almost 300 people in the building - more than 200 patients and 60 staff members. The evacuation of people continues and it is checked whether there are people under the rubble. It is already known about the injured, at least one person died. My condolences,- said the President. According to him, Russia could not fail to know that this boarding house for the elderly is not a military base, not a military facility. -For one day today - at this time - Russian troops have already used almost 90 guided aerial bombs. In our cities, in Ukrainian positions. We will certainly respond to the Russian army for this terror. We will respond in a tangible way,- Volodymyr Zelenskyi promised. As reported by ArmyInform, today, September 19, Russian invaders hit the five-story building of the geriatric boarding house in Sumy. 1 person died, another 12 were injured.

Title: Diesel show: the schemer sold state fuel for half a million hryvnias
Description: This was informed in the Special Prosecutor's Office of the Western Region. According to the investigation, the 59-year-old suspect created a surplus of diesel and gasoline, produced fictitious documentation (delivery information and waybills), looked for -clients-, and also developed a safe route for entering and exiting the territory of the military unit of vehicles for transporting stolen fuel . -It was established that the suspect kept part of the fuel on the territory of a private residence, and used subordinate servicemen to transport and sell it,- prosecutors say. After receiving almost 17,000 hryvnias from the intermediary for the sale of 420 liters of diesel, the military officer was detained in accordance with Art. 208 of the CPC of Ukraine. Several episodes of his criminal activity have been documented. The amount of damages reached half a million hryvnias. As she already told a> ArmiyaInform, the suspicion was reported to two friends from the Rivne region, who organized a scheme to avoid mobilization.

Title: He ran, overturned, fell into a trench: how the occupier was fleeing from death
Description: They published a video of combat work on their channel. -Pilots of the platoon of the 108th Separate Mountain Assault Battalion hit the Katsap tank and sent three occupiers to the Kobzon concert,- the military commented. The video shows one Russian invader fleeing the drone and falling into a trench. He could no longer get out of it. Earlier ArmyInform showed how fighters of the 108th mountain assault battalion with the help of the drone was set on fireforest strip, where the Russians have accumulated.

Title: The enemy army killed an 85-year-old man on his birthday
Description: The Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office informs about this. A man died: today he turned 85. Residential buildings and administrative buildings were also damaged in the settlement. Under the procedural guidance of the Chuguyiv district prosecutor's office of the Kharkiv region, a pre-trial investigation has been launched into the fact of violation of the laws and customs of war, combined with intentional murder (Part 2 of Article 438 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine). -Prosecutors and police investigators are taking all possible and appropriate measures to document war crimes committed by Russian servicemen,- the statement said. As reported by ArmyInform, today, September 19, the Russian invaders hit the five-story building of the geriatric boarding house in Sumy. 1 person died, another 12 were injured.

Title: -Tamara and I are behind bars as a couple-: two collaborators were detained - a teacher and an offic...
Description: This was notified by the Security Service of Ukraine. Two collaborators cooperated with the occupation administrations of the Russian Federation in Luhansk region and Kharkiv region. One of the figures was the -deputy director of the lyceum of the LNR-, which the Rashists created on the basis of the captured school in temporarily occupied Luhansk. -According to the investigation, the collaborator obliged the lyceum teachers to teach the history of Ukraine exclusively according to the -methodology- of the Russian Federation, in which the facts of the formation of our statehood were completely falsified. The collaborator also praised Putin and the full-scale invasion of Russia, which she regularly spoke about in front of the school community,- the SBU said. In August of this year, the defendant arrived in Kyiv via EU countries to resolve social issues. She planned to stay hidden in the city for a while, and then return to Luhansk. SBU employees located her and detained her in a rented apartment. According to the investigation, the suspect is a 42-year-old resident of Luhansk region, who in 2014 went to cooperate with the enemy. Before being appointed to the -position-, she underwent -retraining courses- in Rostov-on-Don. Another collaborator was detained in Kharkiv region. -The accomplice of the aggressor turned out to be a 58-year-old resident of Kupyansk, who after the capture of the city joined the local occupation administration of the Russian Federation. There, she was appointed to a -position- where she drew up documentation on the technical maintenance of military barracks and the occupation authorities of the Russian Federation,- the Ukrainian special service added. So far, the investigators of the Security Service have notified both detainees (in accordance with the crimes committed) of suspicion under Part 2 and Part 3 of Art. 111-1 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (collaborative activity). Investigations are ongoing. The perpetrators face prison terms. Earlier ArmyInform reported about a 22-year-old unemployed resident of the village of Geniivka, Slobozhansk community, Chuguyiv district, Kharkiv region, who collected data on the deployment of units of the Defense Forces on the territory of the district and reported them to Russian curators.

Title: In a new explosive way: drones landed the Russian BMD-2
Description: A video of a powerful drone explosion was published on September 19. BMD-2 is the main combat vehicle of the Soviet-made airborne and airborne forces. It descends by parachute, parachute-jet and landing methods. UAV pilots from -Omega Wings- used know-how - a new method of landing an armored vehicle - explosive.\ Earlier ArmyInform showed, how the Defense Forces attacked the enemy with a robot.

Title: In his first battle, he defeated the enemy's armored personnel carrier - the story of the Phantom fi...
Description: said about the soldier on September 19 Airborne assault troops of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. And although the soldier is still undergoing rehabilitation, he is already planning to return to the army, because in Bilogorivka, where he was seriously wounded, his comrades continue to fight the enemy. -It is extremely difficult to maintain the defense in Bilogorivka. Digging a trench there is a challenge with an asterisk, because there is almost no land - solid chalk that cannot be dug,- says Serhiy. According to the paratrooper, chalk not only makes it difficult to set up positions: it also poses another threat to soldiers. The fact is that fragments from mines and shells are not absorbed by the ground, as happens when a trench is dug in ordinary soil, but bounce off the hard rock and scatter chaotically in different directions, finding victims among our defenders. -My brother, who was standing not far from me, was hit by a shrapnel just like that when we were repelling an enemy assault,- Serhiy recalls. According to the brave paratrooper, the situation is complicated by the fact that the enemy considers Bilogorivka as the -key- to the defense of Siversk, so they will spare nothing to capture this village: bullets, artillery shells, mines and anti-aircraft missiles - all this deadly irony the enemy sends tons every day in the position of stable fighters. But no iron is able to break the will of the paratroopers of the 81st brigade to resist. The story of a brave fighter with the call sign -Phantom- is a vivid example of this. He will remember his first fight and what preceded it for the rest of his life. -At the position, we walked seven kilometers, carrying 45 kg of cargo. It was difficult, but there were still -flowers-. When the orcs started storming us, it became a real test,- says the paratrooper. According to the soldier, after the mortar shelling, with which the enemy -processed- the positions of the Ukrainian defenders, the assault of the enemy's infantry, supported by a tank and an armored personnel carrier, began. At the same time, the appearance of the tank was a surprise for the soldiers. -He descended from the tericon at neutral speed, so he could not be heard. When he started climbing the mountain, we couldn't see him then, but we already heard the roar of the engines and realized that something serious was going on. We saw the tank only when it left, as they say, -under our noses,- Serhii recalls. The unit went into battle. Serhii grabbed the RPG-7 grenade launcher and started firing at the armored personnel carrier, which also came within range of the shot, and his brother engaged the tank. -I don't remember when I knocked out an armored personnel carrier, because I fired five shots from a grenade launcher. I know for sure that I hit more than one cumulative grenade. I remarked about myself that I would shoot him, as if in a shooting range,- says Serhiy. The tank was also knocked out by a well-aimed shot of his comrades. The infantry was partially killed - only those who managed to escape in time survived. Recalling the first and subsequent battles in which the brave paratrooper participated, he says that he understood how important the professional training of a soldier is. -I was taught well at the training center: I could freely handle a machine gun, a machine gun, and a grenade launcher, so I felt confident in battles, because my actions were brought to automatism,- Serhii assures. Those who are still hesitating, the brave soldier understands a little, because he himself did not immediately join the army: he adjusted himself for several months, but in the end he made his conscious choice. But now he says that he needs to overcome his emotions: -Don't be afraid. Yes, it's scary, but we need to go to war, because we won't have a future if everyone doesn't come to their senses and go to protect their relatives, our Motherland. And before this war has come to your home, come to your senses and join the army, there will be work for everyone,- says the paratrooper. As reported by ArmyInform, a fighter of the 505th marine infantry battalion yakyj-72-dni-byvsya-u-krynkah/-> with the call sign -Fartoviy- signed a contract at the age of 22, celebrated his 23rd birthday in the dugout to the sound of air raids at the training center of the ZSU, and his 24th birthday in Krynkah.

Title: Threat of ecological disaster: Russians mined dams in the Belgorod region
Description: This was reported by the spokesman of the operative-tactical group -Kharkiv-, Colonel Vitaly Sarantsev. According to him, the Russians are not only actively building defensive fortifications around Belgorod, but also actively mining general and special purpose hydraulic structures. -This can be seen as a 'bookmark' for the future - if, for example, the situation changes dramatically and the Russians have to blow up dams to slow the advance of the Defense Forces of Ukraine,- he suggested. The spokesman also noted that the Russians could also use mines to carry out an -operation under a foreign flag- - to blow up dams in order to later blame the Ukrainians for this. -It can also be assumed that the Russian Federation is preparing provocations at hydrotechnical facilities in order to further accuse Ukraine of environmental and humanitarian consequences,- said the spokesman of Kharkiv Technical University. He added that such actions can be used to mobilize the local population of the Belgorod region and to divert the attention of Russians from internal problems. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that in Kharkiv region, the occupiers were transferred -to foot fodder-, as a result of which Russian soldiers were poisoned due to a lack of quality provisions, and in Vovchansk, a third of the fighters in the enemy's assault groups survive - the enemy steadily loses up to 70% of its assault troops.

Title: Consequences of the Russian attack on the geriatric boarding house in Sumy
Description: The State Emergency Service of Ukraine informs about this. -The technical and 5th floors are partially destroyed. 147 people were evacuated from the building. There are no people under the rubble,- the message reads. 5 buses were involved in the work, including 2 from the State Emergency Service, as well as 2 medical units of the State Emergency Service for transporting patients to the hospital and other boarding houses. Title: An enemy drone attacked Kherson: there are casualties

Another victim was also treated. A 58-year-old woman has explosive and closed craniocerebral injuries, concussion, and facial shrapnel injury. She was on the street at the time of the drone attack. Title: From a miner to a hero-defender: the story of soldier Mykola Savinykh
Description: on September 19 operational command -North- told about the fighter. At first, Mykola served as a mechanic-driver of BTR-80, where together with his unit he was on combat duty in the southern direction for almost half a year. Then he was in the Izyum direction of the Kharkiv region, where he held the defense and did not allow the enemy to establish a pontoon crossing across the river. Ordered to move forward to meet the column, his unit came under heavy enemy fire from tanks, mortars, and artillery. Mykola managed to take 23 fighters out of the shelling in his combat vehicle. For his bravery and heroism, he was awarded the Order -For Courage- of the 3rd degree. Under the onslaught of overwhelming enemy forces, Mykola together with his unit held the defense for several more days. All this time, the man was evacuating personnel, bringing in reinforcements and ammunition. During one of the air raids after the FABU explosion, he received a concussion, the consequences of which he did not feel at first and continued to perform combat tasks. Later, during another flight on a combat mission, he felt that he could not feel one side of his body. He was forced to undergo treatment, then surgery and rehabilitation. Due to his health, Mykola was unable to continue his service in the combat units and was sent to the Boryspil Regional Territorial Center for Staffing and Social Support in a guard platoon. As reported by ArmyInform, a fighter of the 505th Marine Infantry Battalion with the call sign -Fartovy- signed a contract at the age of 22, celebrated his 23rd birthday in the dugout to the sound of air raids at the training center of the ZSU, and his 24th birthday in Krynkah.

Title: SSO burns equipment in Kurshchyna, Russians were smoked out of the house and destroyed: a stream fro...
Description: A ground drone with a machine gun attacked the Russian landing in Kurshchyna. The Russian filmed a video of him and his brothers having fun in the positions, but after the words -exit-, they had -arrival-. These and other topics are discussed by our presenters - junior lieutenant Serhiy Lipko and lieutenant colonel Serhii Misyura.

Title: General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine: In the Kurakhiv direction, the Defense Forces repelled...
Description: This is reported in the operational information of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine as of 16 :00 September 19. During the day, a number of settlements of the Sumy and Chernihiv regions were affected by enemy terrorist attacks. The enemy also carried out 11 airstrikes on the territory of the Kursk region, using 14 anti-aircraft missiles. On the Kharkiv direction, the Russian occupiers once tried to storm the defensive lines of the Ukrainian army in the Vovchansk district. In the Kupyan direction the enemy attacked the positions of our units in the area of ​​Sinkivka, Stelmakhivka and Hlushkivka four times, one skirmish is ongoing. Ukrainian soldiers continue to maintain their defense. In the Lyman direction, the invading army launched seven attacks on Ukrainian positions near Makiivka, Cherneshchyna, Nevsky, and Torsky. Five engagements have ended without success for the enemy, two more are ongoing. In the Severskyi direction near the settlements of Verkhnyokamianske, Ivano-Daryivka and Vyimka, the defenders of the Ukrainian land repelled three attacks of the occupying army, four more attacks are ongoing. In the Kramatorsk direction the invaders stormed the positions of our army near Kurdyumivka. The enemy's attack was repulsed. In the Toretsk direction, the number of enemy attacks increased to seven. The enemy concentrated its efforts in the region of Toretsk, Shcherbynivka and Nelipivka, where four skirmishes took place, three enemy attacks are still ongoing. In the Pokrovsky direction since the beginning of the day, the occupiers with the support of aviation have already made 22 attempts to dislodge our defenders from their positions in the districts of Vozdvizhenka, Novotoretska, Grodivka, Myrolyubivka, Mykolaivka, Novogrodivka, and Marynivka. The defense forces are holding back the onslaught and have repulsed 16 enemy attacks so far, with six attacks still in progress. Enemy losses are being refined. Fighting continues near Tsukuryny, Georgiyivka, Kostyantynivka and Katerynivka in the Kurakhiv direction. In this area, Ukrainian fighters repelled 13 out of 36 attacks by the occupying army. Fierce battles are taking place. In the Vremivsk direction the enemy, supported by aviation, attacked the positions of our units near Vugledar, Rivnopol and Katerynivka four times. Two skirmishes are underway. In the Orichivsk direction the occupiers made three attempts to attack our units near Pyatikhatok and in the direction of Novoandriivka. The terrorist army also fired unguided aerial missiles at Kamianske. In the Dnieper direction the enemy launched an air strike on Mykolaivka district of Kherson region. Also, the invader does not stop trying to knock out our units from the occupied positions, so he carried out three offensive actions, at the moment one battle continues. We would like to remind you that last day of loss Russian invaders numbered 1130 people. Ukrainian soldiers also destroyed 14 tanks, 13 armored combat vehicles, 23 artillery systems, one anti-aircraft missile system, 63 operational-tactical UAVs and 55 vehicles.

Title: Espionage for the Armed Forces, the Russian IPSO, fakes: what is known about the General Staff
Description: informs the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine about this. Experts examined about 27 thousand units of media content published from June 8, 2018 to July 26, 2024. In particular, in its activities, the channel focuses on the following operations: Analysis of the content of the enemy Telegram channel was conducted by the Strategic Communications Center in cooperation with the Cyber ​​Department of the Security Service of Ukraine and the Main Communications Department of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. It is noted that since 2014, the Russian Federation has been waging a hybrid war against Ukraine, which includes information operations. -Russian informational aggression includes campaigns aimed at discrediting the Defense Forces of Ukraine, falsifying the events of the Russian-Ukrainian war, and depriving Ukrainians of the will to resist,- the report says. Russia also carries out information manipulation and interference both openly and covertly, often masking its actions under the guise of Ukrainian initiatives. In particular, he creates pseudo-Ukrainian pages in social networks and messengers in order to subtly influence the Ukrainian audience. One such resource is the National Headquarters Telegram channel, which is moderated by Russian intelligence services and specializes in topics related to the Defense Forces and is aimed at the military. Therefore, -NachStabu- is part of the Russian information campaign aimed at weakening Ukraine through information attacks, and performs the role of an instrument of hybrid warfare. You can read more about the research materials at link. As reported by ArmyInform, the Russians are also trying for a while -kreml-lyakaye-svoyih-gromadyan/->accusethe Armed Forces of Ukraine of looting and war crimes in Kurshchyna.

Title: A third survives: in Vovchansk, the enemy steadily loses up to 70% of attack aircraft
Description: An officer of the Special Purpose Center -Omega Wings- of the National Guards of Ukraine with the call sign -Storm-. - As you can see the tactics of our enemy, he does not spare his manpower. The main technique is to move by 3-4 people. If someone is able to make it to a certain point, they are pinned and waiting for the next batch. Thus, for 20 people, only 7-6 people who hold a certain plot are able to reach. In this way, they accumulate their strength and spread across the front, he said. Accumulating in sufficient numbers for the next advance, the occupying soldiers try to move on, again losing about 2/3 of their personnel. - Since this is a city, the enemy tries to use the buildings. Lately, he has resorted to the tactic of single use of manpower. The enemy moves singly and accumulates at appropriate points in order to spread across the front and gain a foothold in certain areas of the terrain and push back our forces, the officer explained. In order to gain a foothold, the occupiers use basements and ruins of buildings, in which it is quite difficult for them to inflict fire damage. In order to deliver the personnel to the assault lines, the enemy uses fast maneuvering equipment - buggies. They are just as difficult to hit with drones. — There are also moments of movement on some kind of equipment. These can be buggies, quite maneuverable equipment, it is very difficult to follow. We usually try to use FPV drones, but it is very difficult at such a speed, where the equipment just flies by in a second and it is very difficult to catch it, - explained -Storm-. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that In Vovchansk, the enemy's rigging teams suffered losses.

Title: He called - they will destroy the Nazis - but surrendered the position of the Defense Forces: the ma...
Description: The Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office informed about this. The man did it both out of ideological convictions and for money. He began collecting information for representatives of the Russian Federation no later than February 2024. He was promised to be paid for completing the received tasks related to the collection of data on Ukrainian defenders, but the accused never received the money. The man also acted out of ideological convictions — he was an active participant in pro-Russian chat rooms. There he left comments in which he called for the seizure of power and the -annihilation of the Nazis.- The illegal nature of the accused's statements was confirmed by the conclusion of the forensic linguistic semantic-textual examination. The man sent information about the deployment of units of the Defense Forces in the messenger in the form of text messages indicating the relevant coordinates. The enemy used the data collected by the man to plan targeted strikes on the territory of the district. Law enforcement officers exposed the man at the end of July this year. At the request of the prosecution, he was remanded in custody. He will be tried on the facts of treason committed under martial law and deliberate actions aimed at violent change or overthrow of the constitutional order or at the seizure of state power, with the use of mass media. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that in Kharkiv Oblast a militant from -Somalia- who took part in the occupation of Veliky Burluk was sentenced to 13 years in prison.

Title: -Cosmic- level of treason: Kyiv engineers restored Russian oil refineries destroyed by drones
Description: The Security Service of Ukraine informs about this. The security service exposed the management of the leading research and design institute of the oil profile in Kyiv in cooperation with the Russian Federation. Among those detained are the chairman of the board, two heads of specialized departments, as well as the chief engineer and one of the engineers of the capital institution. According to the case materials, they helped the aggressor restore their oil refineries, which were significantly damaged as a result of Ukrainian drone attacks. -At the request of the Russian Federation, officials prepared design and construction documentation for the reconstruction of three key refineries. The total cost of Russian -contracts- amounted to almost half a billion hryvnias. This amount also included remote support by designers of the technological processes of restoration and modernization of damaged refineries of the aggressor country,- the SBU says. During the searches of the office and residential premises of the persons involved in Kyiv, Lviv and Kharkiv, mobile phones, system units, laptops, flash drives and draft records with evidence of cooperation with the Russian Federation were seized. On the basis of the received evidence, SBU investigators notified the five detained officials of the project institute of suspicion under part 1 of Art. 111-2 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (assistance to the aggressor state). Currently, four of them are already in custody. The investigation is ongoing. Offenders face up to 12 years in prison with confiscation of property. As reported by ArmyInform , the SBU detained a Russian-recruited man from Kharkiv, who was coordinating strikes in the city.

Title: Training of Ukrainian fighter pilots and defense cooperation: meeting of representatives of Ukraine ...
Description: As informsIOU, this was discussed at the meetings of the Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine for European Integration, Oleksandr Balanutsa, with representatives of the leadership of the Swedish Ministry of Defense, as well as research and educational institutions. -Ukraine strives not only to adopt the experience of our partners, but also to share its own best practices. The war is transformed every day, and the Ukrainian military pays a high price for this experience,- Oleksandr Balanutsa noted during a visit to the Swedish Defense Research Institute in Stockholm. According to him, the MOU wants their knowledge to help allies form an understanding of modern warfare. Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine and head of defense policy of the Swedish Ministry of Defense Victoria Malmer also discussed cooperation with Ukrainian research and innovation institutions for joint development of new defense policies and doctrines. An important part of the visit was an introductory meeting with representatives of the Swedish Air Force Combat Simulation Center, where the Ukrainian delegation learned in detail about the process of training Swedish pilots on aviation simulators. The Ukrainian side expressed interest in training its pilots and other Air Force specialists in Sweden. In addition, they discussed the status of the transfer of ACS 890 air reconnaissance and control aircraft to Ukraine, their integration into the Ukrainian air defense system, as well as the issue of cooperation with Ukraine's existing combat aviation. -Cooperation between Ukraine and Sweden in training and exchange of experience is a key element in the training of our specialists. This will not only increase the effectiveness of combat operations, but will also help provide a better understanding of modern warfare,- Oleksandr Balanutsa concluded. As reported by ArmiyaInform, a delegation of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine headed by the Deputy Ministers of Defense of Ukraine Oleksandr Balanutsya and Yuriy Dzhigyr visited Sweden for participation in political-military consultations.

Title: From now on, the main intelligence agency is also in art: a wall painting -The wise man rules over t...
Description: The creation of the mural was initiated by the Suchasna Ukraine Charitable Foundation with the support of the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. And the artistic project was realized by the artist Volodymyr Manzhos, recognized in Ukraine and the world. The artist depicted the successful operations of the GUR on the mural: — The story in my author's style about the activity of the GUR of the MOU in the Black Sea. We see here a personified collective image of intelligence - the GUR symbol, a sea drone, a surf as a reference to a sea drone, a battered -Russian warship-, the hand of someone wise ruling over the stars. This is the slogan of GUR, the author shared his idea. This is the seventh work from a series of his mural works about historical, fateful events in Ukraine. — I created my first job in India in 2015. Then there were jobs in Kyiv, Poland, and Paris. All these works in one way or another reflect the events we are witnessing. Finishing each of them, I sincerely believed that this was the last work of this series. And the next mural will reflect our victory, peace and prosperity. Therefore, now I wish that the next mural would be just like that, Volodymyr Manzhos concluded. The president of the -Modern Ukraine- Foundation, Volodymyr Havrysh, said that before the large-scale war, one of the initiatives planned by the benefactors was the murals of modern Ukraine. The goal then was to unify the country. Murals were to be created in each area to promote the idea that we are one. — But in 2022, a full-scale invasion began and we realized that in addition to systematic aid to the front (more than 150 million hryvnias have been provided to date), cultural diplomacy plays an important role. Today you see a mural that shows the power of Ukrainian intelligence, our defenders, destroying ships in the Black Sea. And the task of this presentation is also to collect 10 million in order to purchase the Magura V5, which will destroy naval targets, ships, so that the Ukrainian people live under the free Ukrainian sky, Volodymyr Havrysh said. He also shared plans to create murals in other countries. -These murals will be the gratitude of the Ukrainian people to all partner countries, the civilized world and the people who help Ukrainians today to resist and defeat the enemy,- the philanthropist noted. Andriy Yusov, a representative of the Ukrainian State Educational and Cultural Organization, thanked the author, the public, and volunteers for the implementation of this creative initiative. — This time the mural — owl, Magura, sea — is dedicated to the destruction of the enemy's potential on the Ukrainian sea and the liberation of our territories. Actually, it is not only support of fighting spirit. This is real art. We did not influence the creative process in any way, apparently, but conceptually, of course, this is joint work, - Andrii Yusov said. — Russian aggression is, of course, a terrible evil, but the struggle of the Ukrainian people continues. And it must be supported, supported by motivation. And, actually, such art projects are very important support. At the same time, despite the fact that we are talking about repelling Russian aggression at sea, this is a very bright artistic project, a bright picture, like the entire struggle of the Ukrainian people. The work of Volodymyr Manzhos is, without exaggeration, a cultural phenomenon. We are grateful that the Main Directorate of Intelligence is now both in art and on the streets of Kyiv. Andriy Yusov joked that today the largest owl in Ukraine has settled in Kyiv, and this owl is certainly inextricably linked with the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine, with the work of special forces and group 13 - Magura V5 operators. He conveyed the thanks of the soldiers to the author and everyone present and emphasized how important such recognition of their work is. — But, in addition to the fact that it is a beautiful work of art, it is also a large charity fundraiser for Ukrainian Magura attack drones, which effectively destroy the enemy Russian fleet. That's why it's great when art helps the Security and Defense Forces, Andrii Yusov summarized. The ceremonially opened mural is a continuation of the -GURKIT from GUR- campaign, within the limits of which at the beginning of September the computer game -Gurkit on the Swamps- was presented, where everyone can try themselves in the role of the operator of a modern Ukrainian surface drone and donate to its purchase. At the presentation, a limited edition of the own brand was distributed based on the motifs of the mural with the author's signature, as well as an exclusive -skin- for Monobank cards and a themed merch drop of the SYNDICATE brand with an image of the mural.

Title: The occupiers are flying away - footage of the destruction of enemy attack aircraft

Title: A militant from -Somalia- took part in the occupation of Kharkiv Region: the terrorist was convicted

Title: Ukrainian howitzers -Bohdan- are financed from profits from the frozen assets of the Russian Federat...
Description: This was spoke the Ambassador of the European Union to Ukraine Katarina Maternova in an interview - European truth-. According to her, the production of Ukrainian howitzers -Bohdan- has already been paid for with this money. Katarina Maternova reminded that half a year ago, the EU approved the scheme for using the income from frozen Russian assets - the interest -dripping- on them - for the benefit of Ukraine, and in August the first 1.4 billion euros were allocated from them. In particular, several member states received funding for new arms supplies. She emphasized that it is much more important that 400 million of this amount will go to Ukrainian defense enterprises. It was Denmark that came up with such a system. It was the first country to contract and pay for the production of Bogdan howitzers for the Armed Forces. -So, we poured 400 million euros through Denmark into the Ukrainian defense industry. Agree, this is quite a significant amount… And that's such exquisite justice, isn't it? With the funds of Russian frozen assets, you make howitzers,- the ambassador said. Katarina Maternova noted that Denmark contributed some of its own funds to the amount of 400 million euros of rockets and thus placed a large order at the Ukrainian military plant. According to the ambassador, in the next tranche of the frozen Russian assets, they want to pledge an even larger amount to finance the production of weapons directly by the Ukrainian defense industry. -From the next tranche, an even larger amount will go directly to the Ukrainian defense industry. Because you produce products of the same quality for less money, you do it faster, you have lower transport and logistics costs, and in addition, manufacturers pay taxes in Ukraine and help support the economy,- she said. The ambassador added that this is something she is particularly proud of, as she was one of the most ardent defenders of this idea. As reported by ArmyInform, the delegation of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine headed by the Deputy Ministers of Defense of Ukraine Oleksandr Balanutsy and Yuriy Dzhigyr -politychno-vijskovi-konsultacziyi-ta-spivpraczya-z-ukrayinoyu/->visited Sweden to participate in political-military consultations.

Title: Archimandrite--faker-: another henchman of the Kremlin in a cassock was detained in Kyiv
Description: About informs Security Service of Ukraine. In particular, it is about the archimandrite of one of the men's monasteries in Kyiv. According to the investigation, the cleric used social networks to justify Russia's large-scale war against Ukraine and spread fakes about the socio-political situation in our country. Evidence of criminal acts was found during searches of the suspect's place of residence in the premises of the UOC (MP) monastery. On the basis of the collected evidence, the investigators of the Security Service notified the suspect of suspicion under part 2 of Art. 436-2 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (justification, recognition as legitimate, denial of armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, glorification of its participants). An investigation is ongoing to establish all the circumstances of the crime. The sanction of the incriminated article of the Criminal Code of Ukraine provides for punishment in the form of 5 years of imprisonment with confiscation of property. Comprehensive measures were carried out under the procedural guidance of the Kyiv City Prosecutor's Office. As reported by ArmyInform, the SBU detained a recruit by Russia, a Kharkiv resident who corrected strikes on the city.

Title: How to turn a burnt tank into candy: the story of a chef with a license
Description: A bright story was published by the airborne assault troops of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. In August, paratroopers of the 80th Separate Airborne Assault Brigade of Galicia captured several Russian tanks and other military equipment in Kurshchyna. Damaged enemy trophy equipment was evacuated to Ukrainian territory by the efforts of repairmen of the 170th separate logistics regiment of the DSHV of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Now they are being repaired. -There were problems with the electricity, with the oil cooler, there were traces of a fire in the power compartment and problems with the wiring in the driver's seat. I don't see any special advantages in this tank, but it is an additional heavy armored vehicle with a gun, which, with an experienced crew, will destroy the Russians well. This tank will definitely not be redundant in the ranks of the DSHV,- said the commander of the repair unit Oleksandr -Chief-. Oleksandr in civilian life is a professional chef. Worked abroad for many years. With the beginning of the full-scale Russian invasion of Ukraine, he returned to his homeland. He held various positions in combat units in the Airborne Assault Forces. He participated in the defense of Bakhmut, the liberation of Izyum and Liman. After combat injuries, transferred to the 170th separate logistics regiment. -How did I get started repairing military equipment? There would be a desire. If I have decided to fight, then I must fight. I will be able to cook at home, in civilian life,- the -Chef- emphasizes. Earlier ArmyInform told about the history of struggle, captivity and return of the Hero of Ukraine Viktor Ivchuk.

Another farm worker, a 48-year-old man, was injured. Prosecutors and police investigators have launched pre-trial investigations into violations of the laws and customs of war. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that in Kupyanshchyna due to shelling on the part of the military of the army of the Russian Federation, one person was killed, seven more were injured.

Title: Artillery shelling in Sumy Oblast: three people were killed, among them a couple of pensioners
